review: We made a trip to CPK after not visiting for a while. After our most recent visit, we were thoroughly pleased with the experience. Jessica was our server and she did a pretty good job. She was attentive, informative and made sure we didn't wait long for refills.  The food was awesome! Since we hadn't visited in a while, they were nice enough to give us a complimentary appetizer to welcome (major cool points for this). We ordered the BBQ chicken salad, Jamaican Jerk chicken pizza and tequila fettuccine pasta with shrimp. Everything tasted amazing! The strawberry lime margarita is one of their better alcoholic drinks. It's a perfect blend of strawberry with just the right amount of tequila. We will definitely be coming back to CPK!

A friend and I came in here to have lunch a few days ago. The food was great as usual (if you haven't tried the jerk chicken pizza yet.....DO SO.) After we left we realized he had left his wallet with $300 cash inside. By the time we realized the restaurant was closed. The next morning we called and asked if the wallet had been found. They took our contact information and said they'd get back to us. Soon afterward, they called and said they found it and put it in the safe. We went to pick up the wallet expecting the cash to be gone but just grateful not to have lost the other things... to our surprise all the cash was inside safely! I just thought that was the most honest, noble thing. This location is a bit far from me but I will make it a point to come to this one whenever I come to CPK! Thank you guys so much, great team and great service!
Walked in waited at the bar for 10 minutes got  no help. No other customers at the bar  The place was pretty empty. Employees kept walking by avoiding eye contact.

I give two stars for our waitress only.As far as Food zero stars.Sicilian pizza was like a rubber and their salad all you can taste was the disgusting taste of onions.lm gonna stop coming here for now.
The bartender that took care of us was very friendly and her drinks were great! My mojito was delicious and the margarita was awesome.

Boo thang and I, came to CPK to have dinner. It was our first time at this location. The view on the Second level was so beautiful. I must say; rhe service was beyond AMAZING. The hostess Brian was very sweet, sat us and wiped our table down. The waitress Jessica, was so adorable, and she checked on us Continuously!!! Then the manager Ann was like the icing on the cake! She brought us a complimentary appetizer.!  The best service I've had thus far!! THANK YOU MUCH CPK in GLENDALE !!

Poor costumer service, I'll start by saying that last week I came here to the same location had dinner and asked for a  "Moscow mule" (amazing drink) here in the pic you can see location drink and time.... wasn't asked for ID and actually never have in any restaurant.. I was with my husband and two kids. Today I came to the same location asked for the same thing and this time I was asked for ID come on I'm 30 years old I said and the server said with out I'd I cannot sell u a drink.. I asked to speak to the manager and he denied service as well.... we felt very discriminated......
California Pizza Kitchen is one of my favorite restaraunts. The service is great and my waiter is always on the job. Food takes extraordinarily great. I really recommend this restaurant.

To start, I've always loved CPK from their appetizers, salads, soups down to their pastas. With that in mind, I called in a take-out order for a cheese and  margherita pizza. When I checked my order prior to leaving, they gave me a five cheese pizza which was different from a regular cheese pizza. Five cheese has fresh tomatoes and basil. It looked good, but it wasn't quite what I wanted or ordered.  We waited another five minutes for the cheese pizza order. After the cheese pizza order arrived, the very kind male manager, who clearly was running around all evening not only helping serve and make drinks, help with the registers and take-out, kindly handed us all three pizzas! He thanked us for so being patient. I already know the pizzas are going to be tasteful because it's CPK, but the manager deserves this five star rating.

Lunch here is great and the staff was wonderful. Our waiter/bartender was very nice and fast. I definitely recommend the Moscow Mule here and my party really enjoyed their blood orange sangrias. I recommend lunch here.

*Delivery Review* Used Grub Hub for delivery.  The food arrived horribly cold.  Reheating it wasn't enough to revive it. I pointed out the food was already cold when it arrived - the driver indicated that he had another delivery prior.  According to the website tracker, the food was picked up nearly 45 minutes before it arrived. The driver's other drop off was in the opposite direction and quite a bit farther than I live to CPK (less than 2 miles). Total time was well over 1.5hours - website was advertising 40-50min delivery. Also, I paid for extra sauces and the delivery person dropped them on my porch.
10 minutes to be seated when we were the only group in line, 1 HOUR to get our food and it was COLD.  The pasta was properly cooked though, or this would be 1 star.

So today my friend and I came to to California Pizza to have something delightful. Let me tell you, Kati our server was kick ass about her customer service and giving us her honest feedback about the food. I definitely would come back and have her bent server. She was so mellow and has a personality a lot of restaurants need to have. I think she made the food 10x better just by putting in all her effort for our dining in. Thank you so much Kati! Keep doing you!

The service is very good but the disregard for safety is not good. I've spoken to staff before but nothing has changed - sad.  The area around the one and only emergency exit is cluttered with ladders, chairs, and high-chairs.

Thank you Alex for being such a great attentive host, also Wendy did an awesome job of being our waitress. Now for the food..I never had the Chicken Piccatta, but when i tried, it instantly became my favorite dish. Us 3 had half serving of a Waldorf salad and Sicilian pizza. So good. But I always come back for their tasty Chicken Piccata.

California Pizza Kitchen is located on Brand Blvd in Glendale. This is a beautiful location as it is right near these gorgeous apartments and a fountain with lush greenery surrounding it. It is walking distance from the Americana on Brand and is on the second level.  My boyfriend and I had dinner here the other night. As you walk into CPK, you are (occasionally) greeted by the host or hostess. When we got our booth, our server came to greet us and asked us right away if we would like anything to drink. We got two iced waters w/ lemon and extra lemons on the side. He forgot our extra lemons. We then ordered Bread w/ Olive Oil. That was very tasty and addicting! Couldn't stop reaching for more!  For our entrees, my boyfriend ordered Chicken Tequila Fettuccini. He orders it every time and loves it! I ordered the Hand Tossed Margarita Pizza. It was okay. Just okay. The dough wasn't crispy enough it just tasted very chewy and difficult to cut through with a fork and knife. The toppings were good though.  Our waiter was nice, not excellent nor terrible. Just average. I'm giving them 4 stars and not 3 because although my pizza wasn't perfect and the waiter was average, my boyfriend and I had a great time with each other and he enjoyed his entree a lot.

First, the food was AMAZING and delicious~~~ first time coming here and the atmosphere was chill and beautiful BUT the best out of all was the service~ especially our server Seri was kind, patient, and attentive. Thank you for great service!

CPK is a chain restaurant that has a variety of Italian food - pizzas, pastas, etc. It's never my first choice as the food is only slightly above average. Anyway, we had a large group of people visiting so we ordered CPK for everyone. My friend and I went to pick up the order ($70+) and when we got home, we realized that one of the main dishes (chicken pasta) was missing. UGH. Also, when we went to pick up the food, the gal told us that she didn't have anymore bread (it's complimentary so whatever). Upon arriving home and realizing the missing pasta, I called CPK. They put the manager on the phone (a young charming guy from Austin) and he changed my experience completely. He took off THREE dishes from our bill (cut our bill in half) and was so nice to us when we came back! UPDATE (June 2015): I came back here today after having a positive experience over the weekend at the Burbank CPK. I was disappointed, yet again. I ordered a chipotle chicken pizza with no chicken (it was recommended to us by the Burbank CPK and was delicious). I placed my order for take out. Upon getting home, I noticed a large piece of chicken on one slice of pizza and then after a careful examination, noticed that there were SMALL pieces of chicken on other slices as well! UGH. So frustrating since I noticed this after arriving home. I had checked the box quickly at CPK but the chicken was not noticeable until I was in bright light. I called the CPK and spoke with Ismael who was the manager on duty. He refunded the charge and sent me a gift card in the mail to come back. I will go back with my husband and eat in person there since our issues always seem to be with take-out.

Great Location! Pizza is not that tasty i have tried many times not the best quality as i expected ! The sandwich is tasty but the bread is always too crunchy cant even bite. Restaurant Needs a lot of changes!

I'm not impressed by there food , there drinks kinda okay. We ordered chicken garlic hand tossed pizza, I like fried onions as their toppings but thin crust so dry and hard , my jaws hurt because of over chewing. Seriously I'm not at all happy with their pizza specialty. They should work on thin crust it's horrible. We ordered pastas and halibut fish too , they are cooked perfectly but lack in flavor, there food is too bland.

CPK was my go-to spot in high school. The place I fantasized taking dates had I the charisma or courage to get any girls to go on a date with me. Today, whenever I go to CPK, I hope to be transported back to those halcyon days of high school where eating chicken tequila fettucine and bullshitting with friends seemed like the pinnacle of social achievement. Instead, I am left disappointed that the food isn't as good as it is in my memories. Not sure if it's because I'm older or if the quality has gone down. Still, it's a great place for lunch (good specials) or for dinner if you're in the mood for a shit ton of food that'll leave you with leftovers.

My kids wanted to eat pizza so i decided to go to CPK and they have new menu baked potato soup it's amazing and the service was very professional. Well I'm not gone talk about pizza it's all ways good.

I will never come back here! I took my friend out here for her birthday and had a completely rude waitress! Here name was Meghan. It took me and my friend over an hour to get our food. Most importantly we got no apology or anything. I recommend going to the California Pizza Kitchen in Burbank instead of this one.

I really like CPK and eat there too often when I'm craving for some light American fare. There are many favorites on the menu but my review here is for the Glendale location. I love their "penthouse" location and view down onto Brand Blvd. There's a delightful, open feel to this establishment. They're pretty hard to come by these days.  Had lunch here last weekend. The two of us shared a full salad (BBQ chicken ranch for almost $15) and a wild mushroom pizza (about $14). The price of the food has really gone up over the years. I still remember the days of $9.95 pizzas here. My usual beverage is the strawberry iced tea. They were nice to accommodate our request for an iced coffee. They don't have it on the menu but they made one for us anyway.  I'm not crazy about their complimentary baguette. It has a raw taste to it. The herbed dipping oil is delicious though.  More than half the salad and two slices of pizza were left over from our lunch. Service was great on a busy Saturday lunch service.

The staff is attentive. The hostess greets warmly upon entering and asks if any parking validations are needed. I feel this is important as many people forget their parking ticket in the car or purposely leave it as to not lose it.  The waitress we had was very pleasant and energetic which is always a plus. Who likes a drabby waitress right? We asked for a suggestion on a pizza to share and she advised of 3 she likes. We chose the Califonia Club, which surprised with the freshness and crunchiness of the iceberg lettuce and the bacon. The avocado slices on top are a good finishing touch.  The base of the pizza has very little if any marinara. It did have chicken bits and you can add Parmesan cheese at your discretion. I see it as a salad on a pizza... Thin crispy crust of course. I had a yummy small plate arugula salad previous to the pizza and it didn't disappoint at a $5 price. It's comparable to any high end restaurant, to it's shaved Parmesan topping.  We had two slices each and two to go! Great lunch experience. Quick and efficient service and friendly staff.

We walked in at about 6 p.m. on a Saturday night.  There were several empty tables but we were told there was a 15 minute wait -- because they only had three servers and they were waiting for more  servers to arrive and start their shifts. I'm sorry, this is a very poorly managed CPK if they don't have enough waiters on a Saturday night. Rather than wait 15 minutes we decided to sit at the bar for dinner.  The bartender was nice, but clearly overworked and frazzled.  It took him soo long to bring my husband his wine that he finally canceled the wine order when he was close to finishing his dinner. The food is good, so it's sad the place is so poorly run.
I have another review for the Burbank location and I thought those guys were a great bunch of people but now I want to add that the Glendale location is just as amazing

California Pizza Kitchen is great because they use great quality ingredients. I always get the spinach dip for appetizer. Great food and even better service!! This the my favorite place for pizza. Thank you!

Horrible to say the least. It seems like customer service and just being polite has gone out the door. With most establishments in Glendale, the workers seem like they hate their jobs and they let it show. The only reason we keep coming back, not to suddenly get some good service but because my wife randomly craves their pasta or salad. Food taste and quality suddenly dropping with every order. Will be making the longer drive to a different cpk to get some kind of actual service.

The food is pretty great tasting, great service. Often the wait takes a long time, one of the biggest flaws is in their recipe and how much salt is used is abysmal. I eat here very rarely because of this but I would worry if it was more than 3 times a year.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon.  I requested a table that had a chair on one side, booth on the other.  Had to wait in the bar for 10 minutes for them to clear it, but then the hostess was seating others and kinda forgot about us until I stood in the aisle to make my presence known, at which point I was told to "just sit anywhere and I'll bring you some menus." We were still kind of in the bar area so the lady working behind the bar was our waitress.  I ordered the Thai and Baja Tortilla Spring Rolls, then a Works pizza and my son had the cheese pizza.  I told her to just put all of the orders in and bring it all as soon as it was ready, not wanting the appetizer to stretch the meal time overly long. I had iced tea and he had water.  The appetizer was okay, my son didn't like it (which is really unusual) and the pizza was really thin and kinda soggy on the bottom and not much cheese.  Price tag with tip -$55.   Way overpriced food and okay service, but the entire experience took nearly 2 hours, which is too long.  I think I'm done with CPK now.

First off the bartender I think his name is Joe was garbage. He was too slow to even take our orders. Even when he returned my change he basically tossed it back on the counter to me. In a lot of cultures I think that's considered disrespectful and rude. But the reason why I gave 5 stars was because of the manager with the hair combed back and earrings. He was extremely helpful and polite at all times. He was hard and fast working jumping around everywhere to make sure everything was going perfect. He was working under a lot of pressure and it didn't phase him. As a business owner myself it's extremely hard to find a manager as great as him. Cpk should give him a raise in my opinion. Food was good also.

The waiters at CPK are what makes this location great, so friendly and professional.  If this was a review just for them, it would be ten stars.  I'm sure I've met all of them here.  So thank you to them for always making it a great experience, and they still do.  The waiter on this particular night was stellar. I think this location as a whole is very confused about what they're actually needing to improve, so much that they got a new manager who was literally going back and forth with me over a $3.74 up charge on the same dish I've been ordering here and tons of other locations since forever.  In principle it was weird to me that he was so adamant about what the final price of the dish should be - a dish that I've been ordering with the same substitution for almost 10 years (no chicken, swap for veggies).  No location has ever been short of amazing at delivering this substitution, which is part of why CPK has had my trust.  This disagreement makes me iffy about how I feel dining here again after being a loyal customer who has spent literally thousands of dollars at CPK.  How could I not be surprised by almost $4 added to the base price?  It really disappoints me and not want to come back anymore or bring all of my family here.   So, I'm not sure how to feel - more surprised than anything.  I think they're focusing on the wrong corners to improve in Glendale.  And it really has nothing to do with the Glendale waiters - they have been the best part of this place and should be valued like gold by the company.

This review is on our server Alfred.  We've been coming to CPK for a very long time.  Food is really good and service is good to, but Alfred was an amazing server.  He was extremely nice and cordial and always made sure our drinks were topped off.  We would come and pick up plates and just made sure we had everything we needed.   I really dislike going out to eat and getting a server who is either in a bad mood or just plain disinterested.

We love this place and we visit often. The best we like is the waiter, Al (they all are good ,buthe is very different ). He was amazing, had very high sense of humor, and was very caring about how we like the food and how we feel spending time there. He wanted to make sure we will go back again. Al, sure we will be back, you are amazing THANK YOU!
I love CPZ, don't get me wrong. The reason I am posting it is that they don't have vegetarian choices on the menu. Or maybe they have but our server just said "We don't have it" and we had to leave.
Not only did the servers point and talk about us but they passed our table  so many times and were just standing around doing nothing while we were waiting for drink refills and our check!!

This review is coming from a former CPK employee. I came to this location with my daughter for lunch on my day off from work and was immediately greeted by a friendly host, I liked how she greeted with a smile, asked how we were doing and acknowledge my little 3 year old. On a side note as we were about to get seated another employee smiled and said have a good lunch, so A* for friendly staff. After being seated we were immediately attended by 2 servers, Jed and his trainee Mike who both displayed great restaurant hospitality. Jed acknowledged my daughter as well and always checked in on us to make sure we were okay.  I mentioned to my servers I was a former employee and Jed and I had mutual co-workers so we had a little conversation about people we knew.  My experience was pleasant, food was excellent, restaurant is clean. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because throughout our dining experience I noticed the host was telling other guests about some sort of CPK promotion, sign up and get a free small plate, which when I overheard wondered why she didn't mention the promotion to me as I would have loved to sign up. Also a group got seated right next to our table and the chef came out personally and brought them a complimentary chips and guacamole. So everyone was getting some sort of special treatment besides my daughter and I.  So I hope all staff improves on consistency if there are promotions and the chefs don't just give out free stuff because it's a table of 4 ladies. Other than that my overall experience was good enough to overlook it.

The food was great but the service was even better to make for a delightful dining experience, our server Kirsten was one of the best we've had anywhere for a good long while; for starters we ordered something that wasn't on the menu for our appetizer and she made it happen... I was very pleased with that. Our food was served piping hot and she was very attentive to our drinks, she packed all our food for us very nicely and brought the check with her when she brought the food with her; to top all that off she was just very pleasant and courteous. I rarely go over 18% tip but in Kirsten's case it was a no-brainer that she deserved more... she even put a little "Thank You" happy face on the check *smiles*. Unfortunately I couldn't upload any pictures when I Checked-in because the cell signal is weak in that tower and I couldn't get Yelp to open the business page completely so if your wondering what we had it was Chips and Salsa (not on menu).. Meat Cravers thin crust (if your wondering if it has enough meat?? Yes, yes it definitely does) and the Tiramisu (OMG, sooooo rich!)

my co-workers and i order from here often, and today was the worst.  A BIG bug in 1 of our salads.   All Natalie ( manager ) said sorry, and she would refund me the salad.   The worst !!!!    they have lost good customers by the way they handled the whole thing.

I went here with my brother and this place is very shady to say the least. They act all professional and nice, but most of the time, they just wanted you to buy a lot of food. At the start, the chef brought some chips and guacamole giving it to us since it was our first time. I just ordered water since I was making my brother company.  During the whole meal I noticed the waitress trying to push different entrees, meals, and desserts. At the same time, my brother was simply trying to enjoy a pepperoni pizza. It was irritating to say the least. At the end of the meal, it seems we were charged $5 for the chips and guacamole. Now this is the what got me most upset. Aside from being harassed, they charged us for an entree that we DID NOT order. So if you come in expecting to buy a certain amount, then think again, cause they will charge you for stuff you never asked. On top of it, my brother got ill from the pizza. So I would not recommend this place at all. They are pushy, they prepare what looks like microwave pizza, and just flat out add to the bill at their own discretion. It's a shame too since I tend to dine with family, but this place is definitely off my list and hope the same for anyone else.
Cedar planked salmon is good and their appetizer shrimp lettuce wrap are awesome! Manager and staff are great!
So bad, I'd give this negative stars if I could! Waitstaff was condescending about my birthday dessert then, got it wrong, which I found out after I left, so I ended up throwing it away.

Haven't received my meal yet I had enough to write this review. I usually have a pleasant experience at CPK however, tonight is an extreme exception. The waitress brought our small plates that were all dirty. When I pointed it out, she noticed all of them were dirty then explained that the dishwasher is broken. Does that mean they are recycling dirty dishes? The drinks were brought to us flat. Apparently, the soda fountain machine is out of carbonation. When I pointed it out, the waitress seemed to be annoyed that we asked for carbonated soda. WTH? Okay, so back to the small plate. Waitress forgot to bring them to us so I had to remind her. The plates just seemed like the same plates that were wiped down with a damp cloth. The problem, still dirty! Not sure if I'm going to eat the entree I ordered. Yelp would let me update so editing... Nope, didn't stay for the entree. Got so fed up, finally gave in and shared a few words with the manager. As he was listening to our horrible experience, the waitress finally brought our food and tried to push my friend in order to get it on the table. I just couldn't stomach the thought of eating the food off of such dirty plates and returned our entrees. I offered to pay but the manager insisted on comping our bill. Will never go to this location again.
This location is very cheap with the toppings. Technically they are supposed to provide a "heaping cup" (corporate lingo) of the topping, however they don't. Try to go to a different one.

We generally enjoy their chopped salad, (fresh, well tossed) and thin crust pizza (cheesy and crispy) however our meal on January 29 was not this. The food was so so, the salad not chopped, just okay, Pizza kinda chintzy on the cheese and pep and burnt the service not up to par. We find most all CPKs have nice and friendly staff but this time it was mediocre, slow and no refills. I hope this isn't a sign that they are are slipping. I get this is an affordable  restaurant, we enjoy it but this time it really was disappointing. When our server asked how our meal was we were honest and he just smiled and said "oh, sorry." Okay.  CPK I hope you do better and I hope your chefs do too. Management are you listening?
Consistent, courteous, and always a great experience. Thank you to Megan (our server).

Looking for consistency in your restaurants; then look no further.  Good food, good prices, and very, very consistent.  One thing that I have come to want is to go back to a place and be able to recreate the similar experience. That's why I came back, isn't it? CPK delivers.
Last minute dinner choice and it was a good choice. The waiter was great, attentive and humorous! The vegetarian pizza is my top choice at CPK.

3 words WARM BUTTER CAKE= it doesn't lie trust them!! Mmm! Oh so good Wowwww! so fattening but man tooo darn good. Service was great when I went. Skip the caramelized peach salad was just mediocre. The name was totally deceiving the dressing they call champagne vinaigrette I could make better at home. it was totally watered down & disgusting. The peaches tasted like canned not fresh & no caramelized what so ever. it was a sad sad salad! was tols this was a top seller. I mean come on really? my 6yr old could have made better!! The plus sides are parking 2 hrs free with validation in their lot. They have the most amazing avocado egg rolls ever! Total diet buster. Cheese, bacon, chicken, & avocado tasted like a club sandwich in a wrapper the sauces ranch & pink sauce were delish with it too. The Red velvet cake wasn't that good my friend said which was disappointing! $7 moscato is a plus too reasonable wine list prices!

Great Service Especially By Julie She Came W A Smile On Her Face and Made Me Feel Welcomed !  I'm Not Much Of Salad But The Salad Here Are Bomb. Really Recommend This Restaurant  All Staff Are Very Friendly ! Y'all Should Stop Here By Often

We were there just now.  Waitress skipped our name from being called and when we approached her she claims that we have been called already. We were just sitting in front of her and did not hear them call our name. We asked for the manager and tells us that manager is busy. We left and we are filing a report to their corporate office. Got the names of that waitress and the waiter she called backing up her statement but would not call their manager.  We are never going to this place again or at least this branch.

Our family was excited to dine at CPK because we had not been there in a long time. However, we were a little disappointed. When my daughter tried to order tacos, she asked for jack cheese but the server said they didn't have jack cheese. We ordered other items and asked to hold onto the menu. As my daughter was observing the menu she noticed several items on the menu contained jack cheese. My daughter pointed it out to the server and then the server brought a side of jack cheese for my daughters tortilla soup. Then when our full BBQ salad came out we were told there were no serving spoons bc they were all dirty. Finally we ordered the pumpkin cheesecake and it was not fully thawed. It was good but we couldn't cut through the crust.

If you want your food burned and served by the manager, this is the place for you.  Very disappointing.  The waiter originally brought the pizza salad which was made incorrectly.  Things happen, no problem.  He quickly said it would be remade.  Then, the manager delivers the new pizza, and it is obviously burned.   Really?  It's not the waiter's fault, but unbelievable that the manager served it.  She did take it off the check,   however, it was not edible.

Stopped here after an appointment, and I received excellent service all around. My server Ashley was friendly and helpful, and the whole team kept an eye on the floor, making sure all of the guests had their needs met. Great teamwork made for excellent service today - thanks so much!

I can eat CPK everyday...this one in glendale is the nicest one on the third floor of an office building the whole restaurant feels like a mezanine. I ordered the salad and literally in two minutes it was out.  Service is hard to beat at CPK.  I don't care what anyone says I know I'm right.  I don't how the F*** they do it but they are always awesome.

Our boss treated the entire office to lunch at CPK last Friday. There were about 10 of us altogether. The server was very attentive and friendly. She kept refilling our drinks, checking in to make sure we were okay and would make the best suggestions. I usually go for the BBQ chicken pizza but thought I'd try something a bit healthier and went with the salmon. I definitely recommend trying the salmon if you haven't before. It's soooo good! Keep up the good work CPK!
Pizza not my first choice of food, but the kids like this place. Service here is always fast and friendly. We had over 4 families with kids and our server, Edward, handled it like a boss!

Arriving for dinner with at least 5 available tables, still told to wait.  Standing in front of the glass staring at empty tables, all 4 to the right and 1 to the left, just waiting...  for a table, to eat.
Good food, good service. In love with their chicken tequila!!! My office always places our order before hand so that we have enough time to enjoy our lunch break

Great service, the staff is constantly checking in with you which was great.  I love that it's upstairs so I was able to have a nice view of Glendale at night. They validate parking in the garage adjacent to them, and you can access the elevators there as well. I love CPK's healthy options, but I went with the classic BBQ pizza which is always a great choice. Their margaritas have a nice little kick to them as well. One of the better CPK's in the Los Angeles area.

Been to cpk many times-dine in and take out and had no problems until this time. The server named Joe who was running the take out was so rude. He needs to learn how to be respectful to customers.  Mainly learn how to be a people person, especially since he is a server.
Has many verities of food.This place is good especially there pizza/salads/pastas and appetizers.They also have great service nice and polite.Also they have a bar/Tvs/and nice tables

I think CPK have mastered the art of pizza! They consistently deliver delicious items. My favorite is the tostada pizza and probably the healthiest of them all too! Prices are reasonable considering the pizza size is so big. My tostada cost me $13 with chicken, but its almost impossible to eat, unless you are my size!  The service is always to notch. Attentive greeters, waiters and waitress' are consistent with their business model. The place is always clean and busy. Which leads me to their only flaw...the unusual wait times. Considering this particular location is next to Ikea, I understand the prospect of wait times, but even when I go to the one in Valencia or Woodland Hills I always encounter the same thing...waiting. Aside from waiting when I'm starving... I will always recommend CPK!
Great food; excellent service too.  We were blown away by the flat bread appetizers.

Their phone service for pick up is stressful if you're in a hurry. Got passed around on hold 4 times. It was a Friday so I understand they were busy but I was frustrated. Otherwise their food is great and I  like the California club pizzaz ! Yummy place!

We arrived at 6pm on  Saturday with a party of 4. We ordered the fried Mac and cheeseballs and two thin crust pizzas. The tostada pizza was very unique and I enjoyed it the artichoke spinach pizza was also very appetizing but neither pizza filled us up since the crusts were so thin. We waited for over 20 minutes for our food, but the waiter was very apologetic and gave us free appetizers. It also took a while to get the bill and for our drinks to be   6:30 there was a line of people waiting to be seated. Though I don't understand why they would wait for such average food.  Parking is free with validation. Probably won't frequent this location very often in the future.

This review is specifically for the Pizza Dough rewards system.  Pizza Dough? More like Pizza Doh!  Don't get me wrong, I love CPK. My family and I have been frequenting this restaurant for years and we have been accumulating Pizza Dough points through their rewards system. But their system doesn't seem to work, considering the points are never credited to us. It has just been frustrating, hearing that a lot of people have been complaining about this for a long time. Someone fix it already...

Very accommodating hostess.  Also, our server gladly moved us to another table when ours was probably going to be too tight.  Ann was our server.  She should give classes to other CPK personnel on what excellent customer service looks like!  She was patient, attentive, funny, and very helpful.  All around, Ann was a delight.   We will probably go to CPK again, BUT for the money the portions aren't impressive.  My parents were disappointed.  They'd rather go to Lazy Dog where the meals are less expensive and you get MORE food.  Also, the pizza toppings (including cheese and sauce) are getting skimpier and skimpier.  The chicken on my wife's pizza could fill a table spoon.  There is a huge crust around the border of the pizza that is essentially a large crispy cracker.  Too much money for average food.  Nice service helps make up for that.  The problem can easily be fixed with more generous toppings and more generous portions.  Otherwise, charge the customers 25% less.
Good service and the food is great! Their pasta and pizza never disappoint and I love the strawberry cooler.

Frankly, I'm surprised that CPK is still around. It might have been a novel, upcoming establishment back in the 90s, but now it is just far beyond its prime. I admire some of their creativity in making pizzas with less than typical ingredients, but whatever quality that may have existed is just gone. While the Sicilian pizza I had surely wasn't skimpy on ingredients and was a good size for the price, there was barely any sauce or cheese. It was a dry, bland pizza where I felt like I was merely eating bread with meat toppings. I could've stuck to the bread and olive oil if I wanted a carb heavy dinner. It's not just specific to the Glendale location, but a couple other locations had subpar pizza as well, so it seems like the CPK brand has suffered in general. They still have some decent salads and a couple other items, but the pizza is a fraction of what it used to be. CPK, it's time to call it a day. You had a good run, but there are a lot of new players in the game that do it much better.

Worst service ever! I never wrote yelps but I felt it was necessary. First off we were the only ones in the restaurant, I had to ask for refills and given we were the only ones in there not once do I remember him coming up to us and asking how our meal was. I would mention his name if he even introduced himself. Absolute worst! I always leave a great tip and I lift 15% out of pity. 1 star just because the pizza was good

The place is ok. Overlooking downtown Glendale. But unfortunately, the cooks behind the bar is very noisy. I feel wrinkles developing in the forehead. Ugh. Our waiter is fast and courteous. Let's see how the food taste now

My wife and I decided to have a nice dinner.  I ordered the wild caught Halibut.  It was so overcooked it was almost a piece of leather. About six months ago I tried the salmon, that was even worst. I should have learned my lesson then. They are good with pizza, pasta or salads, but forget the seafood or steacks. Just order pasta pizza or salad, eat the seafood somewhere else.

I am SO disappointed with my visit to CPK. In fact, I am actually so angry, that I am writing this review at the restaurant. I came in after a long day of work...STARVING and was excited to have a nice meal. I ordered the cup of soup to start and the chicken sandwich with no bacon for my entree while my sister got the pesto cream penne.  The entire thing was a disaster. After waiting for our meal for about 20 minutes...my sister receives her plate first which does not look appetizing at all. Meanwhile, I am still waiting for my food. Ten minutes after we got our first plate I got my order which included bacon, the one thing I was persistent on not wanting. Finally, I told the waiter I didn't want the food and to just take it back because I was not about to wait another 30 minutes for my meal. I usually LOVE cpk and everything on the menu which is why I even gave it two stars but this was a horrible experience.

I really like this place. It is spacious, has nice big windows. Nice view of Brand Blvd.  lots if parking in the building.  Because it is spacious, one always finds a seat.  I also like it because you can call in your order, and there are designated parking on top floor where you can park and pick up, or they will bring outside. Good is always good. I like the consistency of the items and tastes. From the 3 locations I go to, this is my favorite!

I like CPKs and their unique pizza styles and pasta. Glendale's location provides free validated parking. This CPK location is always packed also. Good service, good food and a nice place to have your pizza, pasta and appts!  This is the closes one to the Los Feliz area for me. Located on the 2nd floor of the office building.

I really love everything about CPK  I've been a regular for about 6 years now and everytime I've been to CPK they always get better and better.  The service is always top notch, with their delicious pizzas and pastas!  We usually order the bbq chicken pizza, fettuccini Alfredo and spinach artichoke dip! Yum yum and yummmmm!  I also love the coupons they occasionally send to me when it's my birthday or Valentine's Day for a $10 off $40 purchase.  It's a nice treat to be discounted when you've been going to a certain resturant for so long  Will always be back, thanks!

kamile was an excellent bartender/server, she made an excellent coconut blossom. we sat up at the bar enjoyed the Baja chicken tortilla rolls. I have the watermelon strawberry pistachio feta cheese mixed greens salad and it was so yummy!

Located on the second floor this CPK stands out to me. It calls my name to come to this location and to check it out. I like CPK a lot but I feel that sometimes it can go either way. The food might come out well or it might just taste horrible and way too saucy.  This time around it was just right the flavor was all good and nothing was too overbearing.  What we ordered: Avocado bacon egg rolls- OMG this is a must if you love avocado and bacon together. MmmM It is so delicious but also so so bad for you. But I like it what can I say ?? I'm a horrible horrible person.  My friend ate a Greek Pizza and that his favorite thing to order. He said he liked it a lot and boy did it look delicious. Another friend ordered a kung pao chicken one which is noodle with an Asian twist and some chicken in it or for a few dollars more you can add shrimp. But I think the chicken one taste the best. This can sometimes be way too salty but this time it was just right ;) I ordered something new on the menu which was the clams. I'm not expecting it to be a great place to get seafood but I have been craving it a lot so I ordered it. The sauce was this light tomato sauce which was great for me. The clams were quite a lot but they were very tiny.  Service was alright I wouldn't say the best and they had a hard time remembering to refill drinks. Also the prices aren't  really that great.

I love CPK, me and my partner have been to the one at Burbank and Studio City several times.Last night was our first time experience at CPK Glendale and it was a mess. We ordered a thin crust California Club, the crust was really awful, can you imagine a pizza that is hard to chew?? Then we tell our waiter about the pizza, sorry I dunno his name, he and the manager were nice, they changed our pizza, made us a new one.  Thought our bad experience would stop by then, but , NO! A COCKROACH APPEAR AT THE CORNER... RUNNING ALLLLLLLL OVER. Nuff said. The manager gave us two gift cards as compensation, again I have to say service here is nice, but the food and environment really let me down. Hope it could be better.

So I went here with my husband and we had to wait for a table for 20 min max that's what we where told it and of course they lie it took about 40 min don't know if they usually take long or is just because the place is doing renovations....

The food is always pretty good, but the staff is a hit or miss. I like the location is on second floor overlooking the blvd. it is nice and green to see the trees move with the breeze. Regardless of service I still come to enjoy a great pizza and salad.

For me, this has to be one of their best locations for customer service.  Last night, the bf and I went for a casual night outing.  We ordered the avocado roll appetizer, I, the Thai Pizza and he opted for the Lime Tequila Fettuccine.  It took a little longer than expected on the arrival of the appetizer.  I was a little peeved, but I kept my cool.  Then all came at once.  The servers profusedly apologized for the slightly burnt pizza.  Because of the delayed arrival of food and the inconsistency of the pizza baking process, they provided another one on the house :) Leftovers for the next day!  Woot!

Horrible service. I made a reservation at 7:00 pm here and it is currently 8:00pm and I have not been seated yet. I will not return to this location; although it is a Friday, they should have the decency to take care of the people with reservations first rather than seating other groups of people that do not have reservations.

The worst service ever!!! My pasta is dry, the pizza is cold. We have to ask for fresh parmesan cheese. It was not offered just like other CPK restaurants. We requested for a refill and the waiter ignored us when we waved at him. It took him 10 mins to come to our table. We asked for the refill that took him 15 minutes to bring the soda refill. I am not sure whats the hold when theres not much people to wait on?

Service was really slow, we were given dirty plates and the server said the dishwasher is broken--are we so advanced that we cannot wash dishes with our hands and have to serve patrons on dirty plates?  The sodas were flat and we didn't get any bread also. This location is terrible.  Btw, the manager was very kind and apologetic and knelt at our table to apologize and offered everything on the house when the dimwitted waitress came with our entrees and tried to push my arm aside to place them on the table, which the manager saw and told her "NOT NOW."  We left for another restaurant although I wanted to stay and eat (for free). Kinda feel bad for the manager coz he was nice. I may have to give this location another try.
Great food and even better service!! They have really stepped it up and make the customer feel truly wanted and the new menu is amazing!!! I recommend the Caribbean sangeria
California Pizza Kitchen is great because they use great quality ingredients. I always get the spinach dip for appetizer and the BBQ chicken salad. Their chicken is great.

It's always good here! I am pleased with their service and hospitality! I also appreciate the menu updates...their seasonal add-on and specialty is always good. The franchise offers take-out and curbside pick-up, which is extremely convenient. Overall happy with the quality of food and service here! Oh and don't forget to sign up for "CPK-Dough Rewards"!

Hair in your pizza sums it up! Waiters & waitresses prefer to flirt with each other than wait on paying customers. Asked to speak to the manager instead he/she chose to avoid us... What kind of manager does not speak to customers regarding a problem in his/her restaurant, he/she should have been apologizing for the inconvenience and explain how this could be resolved & prevented...plus, it wasn't even busy! Worst cpk experience ever! Never returning to this fine establishment!
Yum the 5 cheese excuse the tomatoes is my favorite the Gouda makes it mouthwatering & different but the last time I ordered it for to go it tasted a bit to salty overall I love CPK & this pizza

Went here with my BFF (My mom) ... Treated her for lunch just for being a dope homie! Service is excellent ... Fast and friendly staff ... Nice view of the street ... The food here is always great! never had a bad experience at any CPK's ...
This the my favorite place for pasta and pizzaaaaaaa..... Pizzas are so yummy that I can eat everyday. Very nice people too. Highly recommended

Try the bbq chicken salad its really good !!! The pizza is alright,  Ive had better pizza elsewhere. I tried there thai pizza -eehhh ive had better but nice try I tried there bbq chicken pizza -  -___- pass on  this  1 I tried there veggi  pizza - perfect  for  veggi lovers I tried there mushroom  pizza - this 1 is actually cool I tried there pepperoni pizza - had better elsewhere but still good You can get endless bread & oil here at CPK  I know this because they kept offering more & more I would avoid the pizza because it can be expensive for a box for a mediocre pizza pass on it. The bbq chicken salad is really great compared to there garden salad. I highly suggest the bbq chicken salad.  They have a sweets platter that is also very good, perfect for someone who has a sweet tooth you can get your chocolate cookie or brownie fix here

Nice location and view, however, did not receive a single spoon with our large salad.  Fortunately, we had enough forks and it was later explained to us that there was an issue with all their spoons being dirty - what?

terrrible service. i called for a pick up order and the woman recommended that i do curb side. i agreed and asked what time it would be ready and she said 15 min from when i called. i waited, and waited (was patient because I'm understanding) and 50 min later, it never came. i called back and they said, "you're supposed to call because we can't see when you get here" like i was in the wrong, no apology, just rude, and i shared with her that no one mentioned that i had to call. i thought asking what time it would be ready was my answer. then they bring my food, and forget my drink, i had to ask for validation because it was probably $10 and the guy seemed sick of me. in the end i was more apologetic then the employees. need some training, none seem to care or know what customer service is. i would not go back.
some of my fave here: cobb & waldorf salad, deep fried avocado roll, lettuce wrap, garlic cream pasta, plank salmon, all their desserts and pizza! thats all hahah i love this place!

I was hanging out with family and friends last night. We had never been here before so we thought it would be worth testing out. The pizza was amazing, not too greasy, just right. It didnt feel to fattening, I loved it. They have pizzas for vegetarians and meat eaters. Theres something on the menu for everyone! The server was absolutely wonderful, he had me test out a few soups to see which one id like to have ordered. I wish I knew his name he was a great server. I highly recommend this place to pizza lovers and anyone in general. You won't regret eating here!

I'm not going to lie, this place rocks!! The pizzas are delicious, crust is nice, they even have gluten free if you ask. I usually get the Chinese chicken salad they have as well as a pizza if I'm splitting with someone. The BBQ chicken rocks, or the margherita. But they have enough varieties to please everyone. Oh yeah, you also have a Beautiful view of Glendale from 2 stories up!  I'm a regular here and I'm sure it will stay that way.

I am for sure not going back. After writing my previous review they sent me a message saying they are sorry I didn't like the drink and when I come in next time they hope I'll enjoy a pizza.  Um...ok?? Well I went back and really, the quality is just not worth going back. So many better places to enjoy in the area.  Don't waste your time or money.

Not going to lie, my waiter was kind of a dick.  One of those situations where you experience terrible customer service and then - just before you pay the bill, they come in with some saccharine friendliness to seal the deal on any tip higher than 10%. Bleck.  Everything they served to us was either late or cold, we asked for two cups of water, and about 10 minutes later eventually were served. I've worked in the restaurant business and that was not a busy scene; but apparently, in terms of priorities, the staff standing together making small talk apparently takes precedence over customer service.   Worst ever.

The stars are for the food only. And generally for the staff. That is unless you sit at the bar and the person serving you is Joe.  I'm sure he's a nice guy but I don't particularly care to repeat my order 3 times. Also I tried to use my 3 digit pizza dough code you get once you check in. He told me I can't use the 3 digit code and have to give my phone number. I've been to CPK dozens of times and used the 3 digit code ALWAYS. He tried to argue that it must be my phone number. So to enjoy your meal at CPK, don't sit at the bar.

Worst service ever there were many empty tables and more than 7 couples are waiting.  Servers said there is no enough help while two servers were fixing their makeups..   Crazy..  Never visit here again.

Update to my last review.  Looks like the waiters/waitresses have gotten trained a lot better. They seem to be back on track like the old CPK we used to love. Ed was our waiter tonight and he was great. Had a pleasant demeanor and got everything in our order perfect. Checked on us frequently to make sure we were ok.    The food seems to be back on track too. Not sure if management changed or what, but we are happy things are back to normal--being consistently good-at CPK! :-)

We eat here quite often and for a chain I must say it is pretty good.  The restaurant is pretty clean and there is really not a bad seat in the house.  Most of the seating arrangements are next to the window unless you have a large party.  Service is always friendly even though sometimes they take a while to get to you.  I like that they introduced "small plates" (smaller than regular appetizers, my favorite one is white corn guacamole and chips)  The reward points card is worth signing up for as you don't have to wait forever to get rewarded.  If you park in the garage make sure you bring your ticket so you can get it validated.

Service was amazing, the food was ever better. I had ordered the spinach and asparagus spaghetti and had some grilled chicken on it and it was delicious. So far my favorite dish along with their Alfredo pasta. They also brought my food out pretty quickly considering I was with a huge group with alot of orders.

The absolute worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant ever. Tried to order take out online to save time and 45 minutes later am left with cold food and a vibrant sitting rage in my soul. I can't even describe the madness it was trying to get the food and pay and get out of this hell hole. Complete garbage place.

We love CPK - food is usually always good and pretty good value !  Couple of things - pizzas need cooking a bit longer for a crispy crust and for gods sake - serve fresh Parmesan cheese not the cheap store kind at $14 for an entree it should be fresh
Great place to have a quick lunch and the view is amazing looking over brand blvd the service is okay and the food is always the same nothing special..
My first time here and i had the carnitas tacos which were great. Came with chips and guac. My son had a pepperoni pizza n loved it. They service was great and prices were def affordable!!

This is a very good family restaurant. I am not going to recommend the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza that I had because it was a little too flavorful. Just because it's Mexican doesn't mean that every possible Mexican staple food and spice belongs on this dish. I think it would be very good if a few components were removed. I have been to this CPK many times and most of the dishes I had were good, though. The service was good, as well. The host and our waitress were very friendly. Two hour validation if you park in the Glendale City Center parking lot!

Service was excellent food consistently delicious. I normally get the tequila lime chicken which was delicious but I also got a roasted veggie salad with added salmon that so good I may have to get it again. Al particularly was very quick and pleasant.

Im a fan of this place. I would normally not suggest going here but when my friends do I dont disagree.  Been here for lunch and dinner many years ago and I dont remember what I ate, but I do remember the pizza being on the smaller side and it was just ok.  What I do remember is recently when I had the : Roasted Vegetable (friends suggestion). It was good, A lot of food for a salad, and it was very delicious!  California Club. Really well made..  tasted just like any other California chicken club Chocolate Soufflé Cake... YUUUMMY, very good.. too bad us 3 got 1 to share! that was a mistake we will never repeat again.  Our work orders food from CPK regularly, not specifically from this location but their pasta is pretty good, and the bbq chicken pizza is not bad either.  Lets just say Im a fan! =] but since I wouldnt choose to go here myself I cant give them 4 stars...  p.s. at this location sit by the window makes your dining experience much better!

I haven't eaten at CPK for a while, but wanted to use a gift card that I received.  I had the white pizza with bacon added.  It was OK.  Flavor of the Ricotta was overwhelmed by the regular cheese melted on the pizza, and texturally, it didn't do much.  I scraped most of it off.  Roasted garlic worked well. I was there early and it was not busy yet.  The hostess was on the phone taking a very long take out order. After many minutes of waiting, I finally caught her eye and asked if I should seat myself.  She finally put the call on hold and seated me. There were a number of wait staff idling, and there really was no reason for me to be standing at the entry door for so long.  If food is not exceptional, then service is a main differentiator when there are so many other restaurant choices.  Mother Dough, for example, has much better pizza. Service was fine once I was seated and the hostess did apologize.  I like all the natural light in the space.
Nice cpk a bit long wait time but really nice pizza and good service, they have a lot of other kinds of food, not only pizza, spaghetti Alfredo very good. Must try yam
The food is amazing. One of my favorite pizza parlors especially the thin crusts. Very friendly staff and the waiter Aaron was very professional helping us to choose. Thanks

The service was really bad. We had to wait for everything. The food wasn't a whole lot better.  We had been there recently and I had ordered the Kung Pao spaghetti and it was great. Had a great kick to it. Was very excited about having it again, even giving up my favorite mexican restaurant to come have this dish again. Unfortunately, it's wasn't nearly as good...didn't even come close. The dish had no heat. I had to eat the red chilis that came with the dish to get some spice. I asked the waiter about why there would be such a difference and he just replied, different cook. Well, I won't be rushing back for dinner anytime soon. I can easily make this dish at home. Very bummed by the experience.
The lettuce wraps and "to die for" pizza with excellent service is definitely a restaurant that I'll go back

McDonald's restroom is in better shape than the Men's room at this CPK. No running hot water; mildew and mold; 99 cent soap dispenser with graffiti on it. The door to the room was so dirty that when I pushed it, I thought it was locked because the grease around the edges made it stick.  Food was good.  Service was OK. Waiter didn't know the menu but was was attentive to our table.

We came on a Sunday and it was not too busy.  The service was good and the location has a nice view on the second level of an office bldg.  It's weird that you have to pass through Weight Wachers to get to CPK if you come up on the escalator though :)  Seeing WW made me skip dessert out of guilt :p The pizza's always good and I like that they don't put too much cheese and the crust is soft enough to eat.

Really good service! I'm vegetarian so I ordered a salad without the typical bacon and chicken it came with, and the waitress offered to substitute meats for extra toppings and veggies. Even came back after the food was delivered to check that the kitchen got it right.
Great food and great service! Nothing but good things to say about this place. Spicy chipotle chicken pizza, YOU ARE MY FAVORITE *heart eyed emoji* lol :)

I haven't eaten at a CPK in YEARS! But I was craving pizza late night the other day and this was the only place still open (BJs is not an option for pizza... as it is just crap) I wasn't expecting much from this place, but I was pleasantly surprised how delicious the Habanero Carnitas Pizza was... wow! Perfect crust, tasty pork, yummy cheese, and a finger-licking habanero side sauce... YUM! The service was good, and they had a good beer selection. I will be back to try the other CPK pizza creations!

CPK is one of my favorite places, and being the pizza aficionado that I am, I know my stuff when it comes to pizza. Well, I can't believe I ate the whole thing, but yeap, I sure did! I polished off an entire BBQ chicken pizza and it was damn good! Mmmm mmm mmm! My daughter had the alfredo fusilli which she loved and my friend had the Greek (another one of my favs). I've also had the mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza before and it's deeelicious. I'm not crazy about their bread, kinda cold and stale for my taste, but my party seemed to like it. Our server took a little long to take our orders initially, but he provided good service overall. We had a great lunch! :)
Service is quick even on a weekend my girlfriends and I ordered a large eggplant salad which was delicious, also mushroom pizza between the 3 of us the portions were enough

this is a review of service because if you're looking for reviews on the food: good. nothing thrilling.. i mean it's cpk. we were a party  of 11. the waiter took our drink orders, took a while to return, got a couple drinks mixed up kinda insisted he was right (he wasn't) and he also made it seem like it'd be a hassle to create separate checks. ok ok ok, i've never been a server or a waiter, but is it that much more work? orders came out after quite a wait, and then we find out, they forgot an entire pizza. the manager offered some free food which was declined because he said it'd take 3 minutes for the pizza to be finished. 3 minutes was actually like 10 minutes, and then after we were all done, another pizza came to our table. manager comped the first pizza and gave away the second pizza. at least he has good people skills.

This place is AIITE. For a restaurant that has pizza in their name, I'm a little disappointed with the quality of it. I ordered the thai pizza which had peanut sauce instead of tomato sauce as their base. I liked the flavor of it, but the dough didn't taste that fresh. I love the atmosphere of the restaurant being on the second floor of a corporate building with a nice view of the hills near by and downtown Glendale. Overall, nice chain restaurant that I'd go to if I don't want to think about where to go to.

I had the Hawaiian BBQ chicken pizza which was the bomb!!! Seriously was delish! And I wasn't to fond of ordering this but after I did I feel satisfied. Really good & will be going back. Also customer service was great.

The 3 stars is for this location only. It's weird with the parking and elevators that aren't labeled well. Food is consistent at CPK and so I was happy. I got the Thai chicken pizza and some other things. The sandwich and the salad were dry and we had to ask for dressing on the side. The waiter wasn't the best due to our empty drinks were sitting on the table edge for quite a while before I finally had to get his attention to refill it. He finally does but completely misses my wife's empty cup.. Etc.
Great place to come during lunch, very friendly servers, packed during lunch, Jambalaya Fettucinne is great. Food is tasty and the Ambience is great..

Honestly If you have gone to every CPK then they are pretty much the same. The only difference is the customer service in different CPK's. This one is a hit or miss really. Sometimes the waiter is having a good day and sometimes they are not. The food is just average really when it comes to different items, but the main thing here is the Spinach Artichoke Dip that they have which I love.

A lot of my friends hate on CPK... I don't understand why! Their food is delicious, reasonably priced, and have a great variety of pizza and pasta! I've always loved going to any CPK. My recommendation for the pizza is either the buffalo or BBQ chicken. My all-time favorite pasta is the Kung Pao Spaghetti.

On our way home from Universal Studios, Hollywood, we decided to make a stop at CPK for dinner. There was a long wait, but we were kindly offered bar seating within a minute we sat down & were ordering up appetizers. I loved my appetizer and the soups we got it was half pea & half something else (sorry can't remember) but they pour them both in the same bowl. It looks beautiful & tastes great. Our bartender was wonderful, she kept the wine coming & I enjoyed the wine options. Dinner I had a pasta with shrimp or clams (can't remember except it was seafood) it was very good & then I saw this amazingly lovely chocolate cake dessert passing by & I HAD TO HAVE IT! It was the best way to end a great meal :) I love this location, the service, good & location all are great :) WILL COME BACK

This place is not was it once used to be. They have been keeping on shrinking the menu so now it has very few items on it. Good items such as Singapour Rolls do not exist anymore. Plus, even the menu itself was laminated or inside a kind of a leather cover before, now it's just a piece of printed carton...so cheap looking. They do not give butter for the appetizer bread like they did before, now (and only upon request) they give you small pieces of butter that they cut and bring from the kitchen ingredients from cooks....really? Portions are kind of smaller than before even tough they say that it's the same amount because it's measured by ounces, but I really don't buy that. Prices are ok for what they give, but it could be better, like before. I guess all this economy thing affected the chain that bad too, but to that point? I think people would be able to pay a little bit extra for what it should be. Service is ok, not the best service but just ok. I had dinner in a not busy evening, very few people and still i had to call my waiter couple time to ask them for water refills and stuff, they should be on top of that without requesting, now that i think about it I should have not tipped him that much since he didn't deserve it but whatever. The dinning area overlooks Brand blvd, which is nice and give good enviroment to the place where you're eating. Overall, three stars for this place is well deserved but definitelly they could make better than that.

Man. What happened to cpk? Higher prices, less choices on the menu, and lesser quality on the pizza. Service was fine, but man. My normally thick, soft honey whets dough was a flat pile of burned bread. Ugh. Won't be back for a while!

Our reservation was made at 7:00 pm and it is currently 8:00 pm and we have yet to be seated, this has ruined our evening and many groups have been seated ahead of us, most of which I'm sure did not have a reservation. Hopefully once we are seated the service will make up for the shitty experience we had thus far.

Oh dear. We had a terrible lunch here and have not returned since. Normally I enjoy meals at CPK; their Thai Chicken Pizza is a hands-down classic dish. At this location the Thai Chicken Pizza was fine, but the rest of the food we ordered was sub-par. A bland Dakota Smashed Pea and Barley soup was served lukewarm, and its murky green-brown color disturbed our family. My mom's Italian chopped salad featured soggy lettuce, limp salami, and a watery dressing. Furthermore, our server attempted to increase his tip by singing to us whenever he brought food. We couldn't wait to finish our lunch and head to Porto's for dessert.

I'm an avid fan of CPK, but this particular location really frosts my cookie!   I've worked in Glendale for 5 years + and have frequented this place considerably.  I'm not rating this on one visit, as I'm summing it up from all my visits. Now I have to say, CPK does have good food, as I visit other locations too.  But the quality of the food here has just been really bad my past few visits.  It's disappointing :-(  On numerous occasions I've gone for lunch - expect to take more than an hour, yes, even if you get there early...service is super slow.  You would think after catering to all the business clientele around Glendale, they'd make your lunch experience quick and delicious - no, not here... I'm a fan of the salads here mostly.  1/2 BBQ chicken chopped.  Past few times, i was grateful to receive a handful of lettuce, 4 maybe 5 speckles of chicken on a good day... 2 black beans, one piece of corn if you're lucky...there's jicama in this too, right? nope, not today! tomato? sure! let's load it with tomato and torilla chips so I won't notice that there's supposed to be an actual salad here!   For $10+ plus for a HALF of a salad, I expect it to be decent.  not just  tomatoes and chips! GET IT TOGETHER CPK!

This place is pretty cool. I have been there only once I dont usually go to California pizza kitchen - too unhealthy. but I really like this place. the service was good, food was made very fast. Our pizza tasted amazing.

We order from them all the time for our clients or for our own office catered lunches. We placed an online order today for a chicken piccata, thai chicken pizza, and pepperoni pizza. On the specifications, it says no peanuts on the thai pizza. The pizza was made with peanuts. Brian, server, was professional and said because they just opened and were busy didn't have time to call but made me, as a customer happy by following the correct procedures and took care of the entire situation perfectly.  End of the day, there was a MISTAKE but they fixed it and he got the manager involved to resolve the situation immediately. Great customer service.

We had a lovely time here. We sat at a booth with a nice view. Our server was great. We asked questions and he answered them honestly. We had a hard time deciding what to eat so we decided to share our dinner, family style. Portion sizes were big enough for us to do that.  Everything we had was amazing! Our server kept checking back and refilling our drinks.

Been here several times.  LOVE their food, especially their salads and soups.  While waiting for your food, you get to munch on some bread.  Our waitress was extremely nice and tentative to our water needs. As I was eating my bread, I checked out the place from my booth.  Their booths are comfortable and plentiful. I didn't order anything from the bar, but it looked inviting.   My quinoa salad finally arrived, and totally enjoyed it.  No leftovers to bring home.  I only ordered the half salad, but it was filling enough.   My kid ordered the lettuce wraps, and it's still one of my favorite dishes.  She actually had leftovers!  My youngest ordered the pasta with the tomatoes on the side.  I was lucky to get to eat the tomatoes the following day.  Still tasted great!   Free parking in the structure with validation. Join their perks rewards and earn points towards food!

I was really excited to try their new BAHN MI SALAD, but I must say very disappointed.  The flavors in a Bahn Mi sandwich are particular and I was interested in how this flavor would be interpreted in a salad.  One of the dilemmas with the CPK salad is that the protein is chicken; the traditional bahn mi is not chicken.  At best, they should have made it is a bbq pork.  The vegetable in the salad were very dry - pickled would have been better.  Then the greens in the salad were very bitter - nothing about the bahn mi is bitter.  Instead of cilantro or coriander, they used mint as the flavoring herb.  Lastly, the dressing was tart.

While the food really bad, it was not worth the money and I was not a huge fan of the service either. Pizzas are pretty small, a personal at twice the price as other places. The salads are anything but healthy and the apps just straight out of the freezer. Too many better dining options here to return to CPK.

One of my favorite restaurants! Great food and great service! Serj our waiter was awesome and very nice he gave us excellent service and made sure we were satisfied with our meal definitely coming back!

Nothing special. Food is not something special. Service is not something special.They were able to accommodate a large group, but even though I told them ahead of time to make sure to bring out the birthday cake slice they have for birthdays, they did not. I even told them that I did not want to have to remind them again because it was supposed to be a surprise. Yeah, that did not happen. No cake. No surprise for the birthday girl.

I remember when CPK was only an appetizer + pizza menu in metropolitan cities and grocery freezer sections. So I was shocked happy that there were lots of vegetable rich menu items. I ate vegetarian.  The soup was just okay. But let me tell you, the mushroom pasta was the best I ever ate.  Service was very quick and friendly. CPK Glendale's on the second floor facing Brand Blvd. There's easy access with an escalator. Prices competitive to upscale retail food chains.

This 5 star rating is for the server Alfredo. He's what customer service should be about! He always comes to the table with a smile and says thank you left and right without sounding so forced. He's fast and efficient too, he brought our iced teas without even asking because he knew we were almost finished with it. Always loved coming to cpk and this is the best location because of Alfredo!

CPK service last night was really disappointing. The service was terrible. I'm a type of person that does not complain about anything and instead be more understanding. Last night, it took forever to get our drink. We.were almost done with dinner when our drinks finally came. I ordered spicy Bloody Mary. When the waiter handed my drink,  I was surprised...no olives and a stick of celery. They used to make Bloody Mary looks good. I asked the waiter for celery and olive. When he came back, the waiter states, "our manager said that we no longer serve Bloody Mary with celery"! WaaaaI could have paid extra for a stick of celery.

I really like CPK, but on my first visit to this location, I found it very dry. The BBQ chicken on the pizza and the chicken in the Chinese Chicken Salad were dry.  It kinda tasted like premade chicken breast strips.  The pizza was good, but tastes exactly like the CPK frozen pizzas they sell at target for $5.  The Chinese Chicken salad was good besides the dry chicken.   I would come back again cause I've always liked CPK, I'm hoping it was just this one time. I also wanna try the butter cake.

We were here few weeks ago,food and service was great. We decided to try it again. As always food and service were great. I made a wrong reservations but we received an excellent service from shift Manager Frances. Thank you Frances.

CPK is probably one of my favorite places to eat at! They have good food and usually good servers, but this one was a miss. We got our orders in and asked for more bread, which never came. Took us a while to flag our server and it seemed like she checked up on all her tables except ours. She only checked in when we finally got our food, about 35 minutes after we ordered. Didn't offer us the dessert menu and printed out our check right away. Wasn't a fan of their service this time.

I went here last night and had the BBQ chicken pizza, chicken lettuce cups, and a little bit of kung pao spaghetti with chicken. Woke up late last night with severe food poisoning. The staff was nice when we picked up our food which is why I'm rating it 2. And the other time I went here I was fine (didn't order any chicken or potentially unwashed lettuce that time). But I'm in so much pain, vomiting, and in bed all day with the chills and cramps. I thought I'd write a review warning others to stay away from any chicken here. Or just be wary in general.

Well, it was a weird night at CPK that's for sure... BF had a gift card that we felt like using tonight to celebrate his birthday. We were seated promptly and had pretty decent service for the beginning portion of the meal. Drinks were on point, appetizers were good too..but I was soooo distracted by the domestic violence (basically) situation happening in the booth next to us. The couple was running in and out of the restaurant and there was a lot of commotion happening. The waiter was really trying to do his best to accommodate whatever was going on (canceling orders, reordering orders, etc.).  Total. Shitshow. Basically the guy in the relationship ends up freaking out and throws one of the drink glasses shattering it EVERYWHERE! (Including on us). I rushed up to help the girl immediately after he left, but NO ONE from the restaurant came over to help?!? I stood there glaring at servers who were just standing around gawking at the scene...it took me flagging someone down to ask for management to come help clean up the shards of glass everywhere. Eventually the manager made her way around the tables checking up on everyone. She gave us a free dessert for helping out, which was definitely appreciated (and an appropriate response on her part). It just baffled me that no one responded immediately to glass shattering all over the place when there is food being consumed in the area?!?!?!  The event had us shaken up for the rest of the night...the food was good but that whole debacle definitely skewed the evening, and I admit, this rating.

For work I'm always placing very large 'to go' orders and when it comes to having everything ready on time and labeled as asked, CPK definitely knows what it's doing. At times an order here or there isn't quite right, but within minutes they have it fixed.  They always offer to help me to my car and are super friendly. Highly recommend them for large take out orders. Thanks!

Came here on a weekday for dinner around 9 pm.  We were checked in immediatelyy for a party of 5.  Waiter was very pleasant and attentive.  Slices of bread with olive oil was brought and refilled promptly.  Food was so-so.  We ordered tortilla soup,  jambalaya fettuccine,  chicken piccata, cheese pizza from kids menu.  It took some time to get our food but we munched on the bread.  Portion size was good for the price you pay.  I have dined at CPK before and liked their pizzas.  The staff was very friendly with kids and that's a major factor for me to visit the restaurant again.

Always a great dining experience in this location. I have been to other locations but this spot is my fave so far. The parking lot is not the most convenient but if you park on P3, it's easy access to the restaurant.   It's a chain so no need to really talk about the menu but I do like how they can customize my salt intake to accommodate my dialysis diet regimen. My go to meal here is the quinoa and arugula salad with salmon. The half order is plenty a serving and I usually only eat half of it and pack the rest.  Their lettuce wraps are fresh and so tasty too and the market soup I think it's called is great.  The service is very attentive and the servers hustle. When it's busy there is a bit of a wait for a table but once seated and ordered, the staff and even the manager wait on you hand and foot.

I placed a large order to go curbside. Two garlic cream fettuccine's, a child's cheese pizza, and a grilled vegetable salad with the salmon option. The Salmon is an additional 5.00. There's four cubes included with bits??? Am I a cat? A drive home to discover, and 5.00 refund. I'm a former regular customer.

If you want to wait an over extended amount of time and have other people that arrived after you seated than this is the place to come. My husband and I have had to walk out of this location on multiple occasion because if the same issue. I understand that Weekend are a busy time but when you have the same number of people in your party and constantly have other people who clearly arrived after you seated before you is quite irritating.  As far as the food...can't complain at all. The food is always to your liking and if it's wrong they will change it for you.

We just ate at this CPK. I decided to surprise my husband and take him there since he loves this place and he had never been to the one in Glendale. I have to say that this was the worst service we have ever experienced at a CPK. Our server Dom was out to lunch literally. He might as well have been at lunch since he forgot to bring met lunch or any refills. The other servers were the only ones who noticed I had no food while my husband had his meal. We will never go back to this location.

If you've been to one CPK then you've been to them all. Their food is pretty consistent wherever you go. The food is good but nothing that I go crazy about. The main thing I like about this CPK is the location; it's on the 2nd or 3rd floor of an office building overlooking Brand Blvd in downtown Glendale. Sit along the windows for the best experience.
