I applaud the Brand CPK for their consistency. For me and my friends, this always has been the pre-game fueling station, since they close at 11pm on Fridays and Saturdays. So long as no one goes in expecting  fungiform papillae fornication, we're good, because California Pizza Kitchen gets you the necessary starch components of the food pyramid which assist with optimum alcohol absorption.  This effect is time-released and synchronizes with several menu items, notably the Tuscan Hummus (perfect for Jagermeister fender-bender prevention), the Split Pea and Barley Soup paired with Spring Rolls (robust combination, defends against premature ralphing and provides evidence of unfortunate occurence in sink the next day, with literal "puke green" chunxxx and sliced carrot and lentil overtones) and finally the trademark BBQ Chicken Pizza (the original tag-team of essential oils and cheese, providing poultry protein for longevity and wood-fired shielding against random police checkpoints).  They also have new menu items that I'm looking forward to try; the last item I sampled was the Chipotle chicken pizza was surprisingly good in its simplicity; pico sauce blend with avocado drizzle doesn't take away from the roasted chicken and is in fact one of the "lighter" combinations on the pizza list.  Like with any chain, quality varies location to location. I'm thankful that, despite the ever-changing roster of restaurants in this plaza, CPK has maintained.  KEY GRIP: It's entertaining how seriously some of the "sommeliers" here take their jobs; I mean, you're at a pizza place. Get beer!

This seems to be the only place on Brand that, as an entire office, we can all have lunch at.  My boss and other members of our team don't eat meat (WEAK). Which means I've been here more often than necessary. It's not bad, it's not great. Even though this location gets packed during lunch hours, service is quick enough. Pizzas, pasta, sandwiches, salads all in which are pretty good and reasonably priced. I once went to lunch here with my boss' wife, and she made us switch booths a couple times, rudely asked for water and bread as if she were entitled to it, then kept flagging our waitress down so she could get more "crispies" (fried wonton strips) for her salad. I quietly and fervently hoped our food wasn't being tainted, but the girl seemed nice and accommodating enough, so...yeah.

Over the past few years I've been disappointed in the quality of the CPK's that I've visited, they just weren't up to par with the CPK I knew and loved for nearly 20 years. But my visit to this location restored my faith in CPK. The pizzas filled the plates and had generous toppings (unlike the shrinking pizzas with skimpy toppings noted at other locations). The service was very friendly and attentive. The strawberry shortcake dessert was as close to home made delicious as I've tasted in a restaurant.  I'm still saddened that they took my favorite Tandoori Chicken Pizza off the menu but the Jerk Chicken is an acceptable replacement.    I wish the other CPK's in the Bay Area were this good again.

This restaurant is on the 3rd level of a nice building and depending on where you are seated, you can get a nice view of the street and fountain. The food is pretty good and the waiting staff is very nice. Parking can be kind of difficult in the underground parking structure. At lunch time, it gets crowded and noisy. Not a good place if you want to have a conversation with someone.
decent Pizzas.. i like the salads they have at CPK.. too bad this location doesn't have outdoor seating
I have been coming to this CPK since it opened in the early 90's. One of the best locations.  Best food, best service.
Staff is nice, food is ok, sometimes the wait is a bit long (sat nights). Nothing fancy but great for hanging out with friends.

I don't even know how many times I've eaten at this CPK. I've always been a fan of their food which is super tasty, but lacks that fresh, home-cooked feel since CPK's a huge chain. The staff is friendly and attentive and I love the pizza box artwork all around the walls. While I enjoy eating here, it's not my favorite pizza/pasta/salad place.
Love the small bites Korean Beef Tacos!  I wish they would put it as an actual entree!

This was my first CPK "experience." I don't think we have 'em in Washington. Basil-sundried tomato pizza was not too shabby.  Why do the servers look like hipsters?  First, Carne Asada Fries, now Carne Asada Pizza? California is all about Carne Asada. Carne Asada Sushi someday? Maybe not.  Damn Mexicans and their carne asada! The place was packed, so I blame the slow service on that. Our server was a bit space-y, but friendly.

i should stop reviewing chains... but nevertheless... cpk is the bomb! i love the spinach artichoke dip and the bbq chicken pizza. so predictable. however, the service is always pretty good and fast, the ambiance is delightfully bland and they have a bar! (mojitos r pretty tasty).  we came here the other day and my friend ordered the club pizza. i was wary of a pizza with lettuce on top, and after i tasted it my suspicions were confirmed. it was pretty gross, but only because of the bacon. it dominated the flavor of cheese and sauce. but we got it taken off the bill because there was a tiny bug in the lettuce! woo! oh, and i tried my bf's wild mushroom (A-)

cpk is one of those comfy places where you never get sick of and makes you wanna come back time to time....atleast for me. I LOVE THEIR PIZZAS. favs are: chipotle&bbq. MMmmmmM and the artichoke dip is the best. it comes steaming hot with crispy tortilla chips. the brownie sundae is too good.

Okay talk about the recession making people go broke... CPK has really goneeeeeee down in terms of the quality of food. IS CPK not making enough  money to get quality incredients?? CPK used to by my absolute favorite restaurant to go to but now I don't even want to step foot in that place again! I went out to dinner with my mom for her birthday and we order the shrimp spring rolls, Thai crunch salad, and the Kung Pao Spaghetti. Shrimp spring rolls NEGATIVE: it was TOO SWEET!! The noodles inside the wrap was DRENCHED in dressing.. oh my gosh. Also, they didn't even devein the shrimp! GROSS!!!! the Shrimp was SOO SMALL as well.. overall really bad choice of appetizer Thai crunch salad NEGATIVE: Usually this salad is REaLLY GOODDDDD..so when people want to eat salad.. what do they want? VEGGIES duh... okay.. what is up with this "salad" there were NO GREENS at all.. There were a bunch of wontons in it. Talk about putting the CRUNCH in the Thai crunch salad.. but no thank you for a carb overload. when I asked the waiter is this a salad? there is no greens inside..he told me that he was going to make sure what kind of greens are supposed to be in it.. uhm... aren't you already supposed to know? Then he comes out with a little bowl of the napa cabbage and tells me that this is waht is supposed to be in the salad.. I KNOWW!!!!!! Im ASIAN FOR crying out loud! I think I know what Napa Cabbage is... then he expected me to dump the bowl of cabbage into my salad myself... so I told him no.. and he took it back to put more greens in it.. After he did that, the salad just didn't taste the same anymore. Everything was bland.. My mom and I ended up not even touching the salad afterwards. Kung Pao Spaghetti NEGATIVE: Too sweet. Pasta was overcooked. Absolutely HORRIBLE. My idea of this fantastic restaurant just went down the drain after this visit. HORRIBLE experience. The manager comped our meal... but still.. horrible horrible horrible   mom and I just went to pink berry to get her a birthday dessert. We wanted to leave the restaurant ASAP!! If restaurants want to survive in this economy, I advise restaurants such as CPK to up their game.
I always really like the BBQ chicken salad.  Always consistent which is not an easy task.

I recently went here for a friend's birthday. I ordered the vegetable pizza on the honey-wheat crust and it was good. It wasn't the best pizza I have ever had and it wasn't the worst. It was a good pizza with a nice array of vegetables and cheese. We had a large group of people and service doesn't always run so smoothly with a large group. I would go again if someone else chose this location, it's just not my first choice as the Burbank location has a ton of free parking.

I don't know if it was because we came the day after Christmas or what, but the service was terrible. Our server was abrupt, inattentive, and she skipped over all the polite pleasantries. She seemed distracted, and was very vague when we were ordering. The food took a while to get to our table; the only thing that was decent about our visit was the meal. We had forgotten to order for our brother, and so we placed another order after our food came. There was some weird confusion with the orders and we could see waiters all crowding together as they waited for their food. We eventually got my brother's order, which was when out waitress finally reappeared to give us our check. Overall, I was pretty disappointed, since I've been here before and never had this kind of problem.
Slowly but surly these guys are getting worse and worse, never thought I would say this about CPk
customer service contacted me and apologized so i do appreciate that!
Had a great lunch with Family.  Our server Kirsten S. was fantastic, she made us feel welcomed and taken cared off.  The food was good.  I enjoyed the kung pao pasta dish.  Overall a great time.

I love CPK. This is one of my favorite CPK restaurants. The service here is okay, and they try their best when it gets busy.. or I would like to think they do ;) Anyways, I came here with John for Valentines Day. You can request olive oil & balsamic Vinegar instead of butter if you want! and thats what we did :) I ordered their BLUE crab cakes since I was forced to order them... I changed my order for my spaghetti. I requested a marinara sauce instead of a lemon caper. I don't like their lemon caper here. John ordered the Broccoli Sun-Dried Tomato Fusilli which was not good so dont order it. It was bland! Everything was good other than that. The crab cakes were a little mush so the texture made me feel a little sick. Other than that I never had a problem with this place. One of my FAVORITE dishes here is the Chicken tequila fettuccine, everyone should give that a try. Their pizza never fails to make me happy. Btw, the small stall in the ladies room is so small! my knees were like touching the door. and a little tmi, it made it much more difficult because I was on my period and I needed to change something. So take the big stall when mother nature hits!

This is only the second CPK I have been to. Everything on the menu items are  tasty. The baked mac-n-cheese was my favorite and the taquila lime bbq chicken salad. This place is really clean, staff is friendly, food is good and good place to hang out.

Hey, CPK! Ever heard of the saying, "If it ain't broke, don't fix it?"  Well, this applies to your new menu.  There are some improvements, such as the warm french bread with olive oil prior to your meal.  Anything would be an upgrade from that dreadful sourdough bread with butter squares.  I can appreciate new offerings, but why oh why do you take good food and mess with it? I'm referring to your "new" hand tossed pizza dough and the white pizza. In the past, I used to get the honey wheat crust which was soft and delicious. Now the new wheat dough is flat, dry and tough. And the huge clusters of garlic? No.Thank.You.  The worst offense however, was taking away the delicious globs of that soft white cheese (ricotta?). That was what made this pizza stellar. Now, it's just a thin, dry, barely cheesed "pizza." And it's not good. Our waiter said he's been getting complaints about some of the tweaks to other CPK classic dishes, so I know it's not just me. The only redeeming factor of my meal was the delicious (seasonal) salted caramel pudding.  Give me back my white pizza the way it used to be and I will return you to 4 star status.
good place decent food. pizza and pasta and salads are very good. good to bring family here for special occasions.

CPK & I have been friends for a long time. Recent visit: Meat Lovers pizza. The ham was soggy and all that sodium and grease that drained into the crust did not add much flavor. In fact, by the last slice, I picked off a few toppings and done. Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza is still my favorite. It has a spice that feels like a chipotle or habonara with no after taste. The think, chunky slices of chicken can just as easily be picked off and eaten without the pizza. Service is generally pretty good at this location - refills plentiful, reminder to validate parking, etc.
Came here with my girlfriend dinner time was great not to long of a wait the waiter was friendly and fast, food was good. I like how the location is upstairs its really cool

Basically this place is delicious.   I recommend that you start it off with the Spinach Artichoke Dip.  To be honest I hate artichokes, but I love me this dip.   Then you either a pizza or pasta.  I personally like the BBQ Chicken Pizza, Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, and the normal Fettuccine.  They are quick, and delicious.  Been here many a birthday.

either their portions got REALLLLY small or  this place is the most stingiest CPK.  After begging my friend to come here for lunch cause i love their thai crunch salad, I felt so bad after the meal, I insisted to pay. He ordered the chicken fettucini tequila pasta plate. I seriously thought he ordered from the kids menu. He finished it within 4-5 bites.  So we asked for more bread, and the waiter literally gave us 2 smallll ass slices of bread. niiiiiiiiiceeee. 2 thumbs up!

Came here a couple weeks ago with the bf. It was his first time coming to CPK and I have been to this location several times and enjoyed it in the past. I ordered an iced tea and he got a raspberry tea. Instead of iced tea I got water and then his raspberry tea tasted really weird it didn't have much of a tea or raspberry flavor. Eventually I got my iced tea and he got a new raspberry tea which still tasted weird. For the food I got a roasted artichoke and spinach pizza which was pretty good. When placing the order the bf asked what dressings comes on the california club sandwich, the waiter failed to mention there is brown mustard, which he doesn't like at all.

I usually eat at CPK for lunch time, and I usually come alone to get some work done and relax.  This actually is one of my favorite CPK restaurants because the ambiance is quite cool, and it overlooks the city of Glendale.  You may be wondering "Gaby that sounds nice, is this a good place for a date?" Ah, good thing you asked.  In the many times I have been here, I have seen some good dates and some terrible ones.  Today for example there was this couple, and it just wasn't working.  She was so nervous, she kept eating all the food, and then she would complain about how fat she was, poor guy couldn't get a word in edge-wise.  They did however both agree how great their pizza was and it, quote "reminded her of Italy." Now I have been to Italy, and I don't know how close it comes to it, but when I come to CPK, I enjoy ordering the BBQ chicken pizza, but lately, ever since the small bites menu has come out, I am all about the Asparagus Arugula salad, and the small bites chicken quesadilla.  It fills me up completely, is fresh, delicious, and it costs around $10 total.  The service is always friendly, and I always have an overall good experience.  I do however no longer feel comfortable at the bar, because every time I go, some old guy hits on me, so I just get a table now.  Hope this covers all aspects of your questions about CPK Glendale!

Went to this location for the first time today. I have nothing but good things to say, we were seated fairly quickly upon arriving. Our food was great, i was trying to decide between pizza and pasta. The pasta won me over, i had a pesto chicken pasta with multigrain penne. It was perfect, would definitely get it again. For us people who are watching their diet, they provide an alternative for pastas replaced with multigrain, and for pizza; it can be replaced with whole wheat flour. We also had fried mac and cheese brought by the manager to our table for being first timers. They were delicious. Overall service and food were great, would definitely come back!

I love CPK! No it's not authentic Italian pizza, NY pizza or Chicago style pizza, but it's creations are pretty darn good.  I adore their carnitas pizza, it's soooo good! It comes with a side of habanero salsa that makes the pizza that much more delicious. Beware, it's incredibly spicy which I love! I also really like their BLT pizza....yum.
BBQ CHICKEN everything! Thats all I have to say about CPK, love this place, a very classic restaurant ;]

Yes, I love the CALIFORNIA PIZZA KITCHEN. But... this GLENDALE location is my most favorite one out of them all. It all started, when my friend Deanna (who lived in Glendale at that time) had her 19th Birthday lunch party here (Feb 1999)! It was the very first time that I had ever been to a CPK before! I fell in LOVE with their FOOD & the nice friendly people that work there! So I then had my High School Graduation party here in July of 1999. Then following.. I had my 21st, 22nd, & 26th Birthday lunch party's here! My sister Cindy liked it so much as well, that she had her college graduation party here! All at the CALIFORNIA PIZZA KITCHEN in GLENDALE.  Yes, I have been to the CPK in Burbank & Hollywood & West Hollywood & Valencia & other locations yes! But let me tell you WHY I like THIS one the BEST out of them all. It is because.. #1 the atmosphere! I like it how it is up on the top floor & the walls are all glass! I like the water fountain outside the window! The atmosphere is nice & fun! &.. #2 the extremely VERY friendly NICE fun people that work there! (waiters & managers) Their food is YUMMY & their service is GREAT!!!! I have never ever disliked any entree! But... my personal favorite dish here is the "Thai pasta linguine with shrimp & Chicken" (Oooh & with EXTRA sauce on the side). DELISH!! =)
Excellent service and management! Very kind and knowledgeable to their customers. Always looking to see what's needed without being intrusive with a great attitude. Definitely coming back again!
Love this location. Try to get a booth near the window overlooking Brand.

I'm usually a fan of CPK but this location was just OK for me.  I thought the actual restaurant was large, roomy, the host was friendly and the service was decent.. it was just the food didn't come out as good as it normally does.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't the best I've ever had either.  You would think all CPK's have to taste identical since it's the same company, but I don't get it.  This one is lacking something in their pizzas and salads. I tried the Moroccan something salad, I don't remember seeing this on the menu before, maybe I just never paid attention, but it wasn't all that great.  The combination of the fruit inside the salad was not so good.   We also got a chicken dish which the portions came out huge but the chicken was kind of on the tougher chewier side.   I just don't know if I'd return, based on my experience.  I think much like the Mann Exchange across the street, there are certain businesses in Glendale that were all the rage in the 90's and are faltering now. I haven't felt this disappointed since I went to Macaroni Grill.

Service was pretty fast despite the fact that we were a large party. It must have been a good day. I ordered the BBQ Chicken salad - can't go wrong on this one. This CPK in Glendale was probably the biggest and roomiest CPK I've seen. Nice location, great view from the upper floors, and lots of windows.

Got chicken dumplings, The Works Pizza, The Meat Cravers and found all of it to taste like glorified Denny's, pizza-style.  Everything tasted pre-made/frozen.  Not impressed.  Food was mediocre at best and NOT CHEAP.  Nice atmosphere and friendly service, but won't be coming back here anytime soon.  Save your money and go find some real pizza.

My friends and i probably keep CPK in business.  Our evenings... - round of PEACH LEMONADES... - "bread & butter please!" - an order of SPINACH & ARTICHOKE DIP~ (with the bread is even better) - main dishes:  BBQ CHICKEN PIZZA CARNE ASADA PIZZA CHICKEN TEQUILA FETTUCCINE JAMBALAYA WALDORF CHICKEN SALAD W/ VINAIGRETTE DRESSING LETTUCE WRAP WITH CHICKEN (always consists of some combination of these) - stuffed... CHECK PLEASE! let me just RANT bout how their spinach artichoke dip... A MUST GET. its probably going to be best you ever had...

I'm not a big fan of the pizzas at CPK but Jr. Yelpers really like them. Most of the parking is street with active meters even late at night for $1/hr up to 3 hrs. or free validated parking for 90 mins in the lot. This CPK is located in the Glendale City Center with an Olive Garden restaurant below it and you take the escalator upstairs to CPK.  We tried 3 pizzas: (ranging from $12.49 to $13.99 each)  The BBQ Chicken & Bacon was better than the Hawaiian BQ Chkn (this was too sweet as was the BBQ sauce).  My fav was the Roasted Garlic Chx but I couldn't eat more since Jr. Yelper didn't want to share and would only allow me a bite even 'tho i was paying for it! The full Caesar, $10.29 was really good and we shared it.  Nice tasting dressing and a huge mound of lettuce (too much for one to eat).  Sodas are almost $3 and $1.59 for milk.   Our waitress was friendly.  We did have about 1/3 pizza left to take home.  Great view (lots of windows) of the neighborhood.

I like this CPK location because it has beautiful views of Downtown Glendale. I have never had a problem with the food here, it's always great. The service is hit or miss. Sometimes you get great servers who are attentive and other times you get a server who shows up to take your order and you have to spend the rest of the time trying to track them down for a refill. But I always come back because overall I enjoy my dinning experience.
Bad service... Waited 17 minutes before someone came to our table to take our orders. Waited another 27 minutes for our food. Really? For a regular cheese pizza and a veggie pasta dish?

I really find this place to be a bit over priced for what it is, but my daughter loves it.  I used to take her a lot when they accepted my employee pass in return for a 20% discount, but they've discontinued this perk. We always order the gyoza (they call it something else) and I love the fat free asparagus soup.  The cool thing that they do is allow her to order off of the kids meal, even though she's a bit older than stated.  She eats like a bird and a full meal would be a waste since she poo-poo's the leftover circuit.   I usually get the pear pizza and that makes two to three meals for me.   A chain is a chain, but at least they have fresh and interesting pizzas.

We had the most delightful waitress (her brother works there, too.)  She was bright and very customer focused.  My soup had no flavor and there was no longer another good soup not full of cream.  This restaurant will substitute ingredients in order to lighten up the dishes.   We had a great view of the sidewalk which made the experience special.

Not really authentic pizza. But it does say "California" pizza. So whatever that is. I prefer real NY style pizza. and this can't compare. Bread had lots of sugar. Not worth going back for pizza. Service was usual.

CPK has usually been a safe bet for decent food.  Its relatively inexpensive and there's a fairly good selection of Pizzas to have.  Service has been good and pretty consistent the times I've come here.  There's only been one time where it was a bit 'bothersome' to be here and it was due to a crying baby that wouldn't stop crying for about 10 min.  But hey, what can you do...

This is My Favorite California Pizza Kitchen, maybe because its on the 2nd floor and you can see the outside. idk. but i love this one! the one in burbank i a little bit more casual. I would recommend most of the dishes here, except the cheeseburger pizza! that was CRAP!...but i think your safe with everything else. My Favs:  TEQUILA FETTUCCINE,  PEACH LEMONADE, & MANGO TANDORI CHICKEN PIZZA....which i think they dont have anymore GGRRRRRRRRR!!!!!!!!!!
fish tacos are nothing to rave about. portion was small for the price. free olive oil and bread are good. my waiter was awesome.

As we were about to be seated, someone came from the other side of the room and said "we're closed".  I look at my phone and it's before closing time. With one guy welcoming you, validating your parking and the other turning you away, you get the impression that their customer service just plain sucks.  Good thing Olive Garden is downstairs.  Screw YOU CPK!   I didn't want your overpriced food anyway.

I felt compelled to write a review for this place following tonight's meal because the experience was just that memorable enough for me.  We were a party of 6 adults with 3 children all 5 years and under, yet we were seated promptly. You would expect it to be packed on a Saturday night, but for some reason--maybe the Olive Garden downstairs took more of their customers this evening, who knows--we got lucky. I like that this location sits on the second floor because they have panoramic windows that wrap around the building so you have the view of downtown Glendale. It makes for a very picturesque background instead of just plain old walls. Really nice, especially if you're out on a date. ;)  We didn't wait too long for our server, who's name was Del. And what I've noticed about most members' experiences, it really all depends on who your server is for that night. Let me tell you, ours was awesome! I have absolutely nothing bad to say about him. If I could rate this based on service and quality of food alone, I would have given it five stars, BUT, I can't be too generous just yet. First things first, Del got our drink orders and let us know that if we wanted to add appetizers he'd be happy to wait for us to make our decisions. And with a group, it's almost guaranteed that this process takes a while. He was really patient and very friendly, always quick with the 'You got it!' or 'Don't worry, I got you' that really sets the tone of the whole restaurant, one that is upbeat and positive.  My two children ordered a small cheese pizza off of the children's menu, which they shared. And two slices is just right for little ones who don't eat very much so that was good. Some of my friends ended up with a variety of pizzas, pasta dishes, and salads. Del brought out this habanero salsa to add to the salads that significantly amped the flavor. We loved it! It definitely made a difference! I ordered the chicken tequila lime fettucine. It was a toss-up between that and the asparagus and spinach spaghettini, which I told him I was planning to get. He suggested the first, so I got that. Our drinks came right away, I love the different types of teas you can choose from. Mine was a mango iced-tea, really delicious and refreshing! And they have free refills! One of my friends ordered tea and later when she asked for more hot water, he gave her an extra bag! How nice is that?! Before our food arrived, we got bread and butter on the house while we waited for our order.  Strike 1: Okay, now this is partly the reason for the missing star. I mean, what happened to their bread?  It tasted like old bread crumbs. Not even dipping it in the vinegar and olive oil or slapping butter on it helped. Not the kind of quality bread I've been accustomed to when I've eaten at CPK in the past. Good thing our food came out right away. My chicken tequila lime fettucine was ALL THAT. I don't think they could have improved it in any way...okay, after I added another wedge of lemon zest to it did it taste complete, but it was perfect! I ate EVERY. BITE. I seriously didn't leave anything on the plate. :) I was really glad I went with that order.   Strike 2: If I had gone with order option #2 and wanted to add chicken, it would have been $4.00 extra, or sauteed mushrooms, would have been $1.00  REALLY? A dollar extra for some shrooms?? Get outta here! So what might have been an $11.00 meal could have easily turned into $16.00. Geez. They're lucky they had fantastic service, not to mention our group is the 'hearty' type with lots of conversations, laughter and a young toddler just beginning to learn table manners, leaving a garden of uneaten food underneath the table. We left that place a mess! Thanks for your patience CPK! Our bill came out to a total of $130ish..not bad for all the stuff we ate and drank!   Keep up the good work and give that server, Del a raise, he's got awesome serving and people skills!

I am a big fan of CPK - normally have a salad or the BBQ Chicken pizza plus pineapples and bacon. This location is large and seats a lot of people for lunch.  If you end up trying to get in for dinner there is normally a 15-20 minute wait.   Today, specifically, lunch was extremely slow - I had a late lunch around 1:30pm, with a client.  We ended up waiting a few minutes before our presence was acknowledged at the entrance podium.  Once seated, we waited a full 27 minutes before our food was delivered.  Normally this would not be a problem, granted the bottomless ice-tea continues to be bottomless.  They missed our refills from the time we sat until the food came out.  Without apology. One bad experience won't change my mind.  I will still be a frequent visitor to CPK.
This CPK location is a really good one.  Their service is great, the restaurant is clean, and the food is good too.  No complaints here.

True to what other reviewers have said, this particular CPK has exceptional service. The hostess makes sure your parking is validated and bartender was very friendly. We opted to take one of the many seats at the bar since the wait for a table was 45 minutes. The drinks were strong and tasty and the food was prompt and delicious. I live up the street and it's good to know I can count on CPK when Glendale's many other independent culinary establishments are such flops.

I just moved to CA from the east coast and loved CPK from time to time while there. Since pizza on the west coast is nowhere near as good as in Philadelphia, my husband and I went here for some familiarity after happy hour tonight. Service was fine, food tasted the same, but halfway through his meal my husband bit into a hard object that he thought was a black peppercorn. It was actually a small metal screw. Completely shocked and disgusted, we told our waitress, who in turn told the manager. The manager came by to apologize and offered another pizza but we refused, asking for it to be taken off the bill instead. She asked about dessert, which we refused. The waitress came by to ask about dessert. We refused again and were given the bill. I don't want to sound greedy but we were surprised that the entire bill wasn't comped. We were planning on meeting friends after but my husband had to come home and floss, which he has been doing for the past half hour while bleeding out of his mouth. Will definitely avoid this location in the future.

Chicken Caesar Sandwich, get it on the Herb Bread, with Caesar salad on the side, this is a really good and cheap plate only cost around $10.99 that's nothing for dinning out... Oh of course you got to get water or else that's another $2.99. I am into the whole pizza thing but I learned that the sandwiches at CPK are a lot better the pizzas ironically, I rather get the BJ's pizza and pizooki combo, but that's just me, CPK has way better sandwiches than BJs...take it or leave it! Thanks For Reading
I started buying the frozen pizza and loved them. I figured I should have a fresh one made instead of buying a frozen pizza box :P I ordered the BBQ Chicken pizza and I have to say it is awesome!
i love their BBQ Chicken Pizza also you have to try their new Habanero Carnitas Pizza my friend had it and she was dying afterwards..ha ha ..its delicious when your in the mood for Pizza!

The location deserve a star ready! Well, this is one of the best CPK because of the location. It's right up stairs of the olive garden. And their food are decent. I love their food. And a big fan of the chicken garlic pizza!!! Just talking about it makes me crave for CPK! If you like pizza n garlic you gotta give this place a try. The price are decent not too expensive.  The service was good, yes I will come back!

it's kinda funny, i've tried their frozen pizzas tons of times but never went to the restaurant to try it fresh until last year. CPK definitely is great with their funky little pizzas. i love their shrimp scampi pizza. mmmmm. and their avocado egg rolls are a must have as an appetizer. they also have flavored iced teas and i usually get peach.  a decent spot for a quick lunch that your tastebuds will not regret!

Best CPK. Our server Nikki was friendly and gracious without being overbearing. Attention to detail was put into each dish we ordered. The host validated our parking ticket right when we walked in (I assume so that we won't forget!). Great view!

im not picky. so when i award a location five stars it usually means the food, service, and ease of arriving/leaving to said location was on point. it doesnt mean the chef is top notch or they served the best expensive wine. good food is meant to be enjoyed in every possible (and comfortable) way.  i dont crave CPK. in fact, if i wanted pizza i could just walk across the street from my apartment and get it for cheap. but i was so impressed with how awesome i felt entering and leaving this place.  the parking garage entrance is located on broadway and brand. the entrance to CPK is on the 3rd level, so park in that area. it was the middle of the day on sunday, but i pulled right into an open spot. once i reached the hostess, she offered to validate my parking ticket right away. quality service, and i havent even been seated yet! im on a mission to try every pizza on the menu, and i havent been disappointed yet. i stick with my favorite appetizers (garlic foccocia, artichoke dip, those eggroll things...) when i return, but it takes me so damn long to decide which pizza to try because they all sound so good. so this time around, i got two.  while we enjoyed our meal, our waitress was extremely attentive, pleasant, and NOT a ruhtard for once. the bill was exceptionally inexpensive for all the food we ordered and didnt eat. AND they even said goodbye as we were walking out the door. these might all be standard things you expect when dining out, but you usually dont receive it. im glad i can expect good things at a chain of all places, and leave happy, stuffed, and leftovers in hand.

I honestly can say that I have never had a bad experience at CPK. I particularly like this location, too! I just looooove their Thai Chicken Salad crunchy goodness. And basically every type of pizza they have to offer is awesome. Hooray for CPK. Plus, they give 10% local students at most CPKs, inquire within.

I give 5 because I was highly pleased with the service. So many places suck. This place didn't. 1 Mango and peach lemonade. The peach was a little too sour but I liked it. I never find these anywhere else so they are a fun different drink. 2 Hummes appetizer with pita bread - tasty and fresh and came promptly. I even licked the spoon.  3 Miso salad with crab and shrimp - super fresh and i loved the variety of napa cabbage, edamame, green onion, avocado, and the crab and shrimp. Not enough of the miso dressing but I got more later. Yay for weird salads. 4 "The works" pizza with bacon added - yum. I prefer BBQ chicken but this one was good too. Mmmm.. bacon. 5 Bread - I had to request it because I think the server thought there was enough food. WRONG because I love the bread... plus I hadn't eaten the whole day. I love you bread. So anyways, that was food reviews. All of it was fresh, delicious.  Then comes service: We only waited about 10 minutes on a Friday night which is awesome since Olive Garden and BJ's had a 40 million  minute wait. Waiter came promptly and took our entire order (we planned during our 10 minutes) then everything came out smoothly.  When I asked for more dressing or bread it came in a minute or sooner. Awesome!  He came and checked on us, got us refills, and tried to chit-chat but I was too busy eating.  At the end the bill with all of the above as about 20 per person with a 8 dollar tip. Not bad at all and I was happy.
I don't eat salads much but I LOVE their green field salad with caramelized walnuts. I always ask to add shrimp that takes the salad to a next level to please my taste buds!

I used to like this location because I felt posh dining here in high school. Yes, expensive pizzas I could gobble up in three bites while onlooking the view of downtown Glendale was posh for me. I've only tried the white and the shrimp scampi pizzas at this location. Totally kicks Pizza Hut in the crotch and sends it home to mama bawling. And that is an understatement, of course. If a hot little Asian mama named Jessica B. still works there, tell her I said hi =).

Haven't had CPK in years til I found out they had a gluten free menu. This location is down the street from my office so now I go often. The food is great. The service is even better. They are quick and courteous. I will be back, regularly.

Okay, so i'm always a little hesitant when writing about chains because well, frankly, whats the point. But I like CPK and their cocktails are pretty good too. I like the Glendale location because it has a nice view if you get a window seat and I don't think I've ever waited more than 5 minutes on a weekend.

Before the cheesecake factory and BJ's opened in Glendale, we used to go to this place about once per month. Overall, I always get the sense that I have been ripped off when I finish eating here. I mean, they charge like $15 for a salad which is the size of CF's or BJ's lunch size salads which cost no more than $8-9. And now, it is almost impossible to find a food item on the menu which is below $10. The thing that gets me is the fact that their food doesn't even taste that great, just average. I stopped going here after CF and BJ's opened in Glendale and I suggest you do the same.

I'm not a fan of Italian food but my family does, a home cook spaghetti is as close as i can get. Ambiance is great, service is fast, waiters are attentive. a good place to bring your family. Needless to say, we went there twice this week.. The food........still Italian, Maybe next time I'll dare myself and try linguini

I have been to CPK before, but this latest trip was a scene out of a movie.  The pizza was so so, but our server was the worst.  waiter.  ever.  It was to the point of being amusing.  The funniest part was when he took my credit card, returned ten minutes later and gave me back the exact same thing he picked up.  Nothing to sign, just the bill and my credit card.  I told him, "There's nothing to sign."  His response?  "Oh, you know what happened?  I forgot to run your credit card."  Are you serious?!?  WOW!

I love, love, love pizza.  Love.  So being here is like, ooh.  Pepperoni + mushroom = bliss.  My group has tried their salads, and each are yum, according to them.  I think this place is great for groups; their service will not disappoint you.  It'll also help to share your pizza with someone, since they give such generous portions.

This place is pretty dirty.  From when I got there, I couldn't believe the filth.  There was left over food on my side of the booth when I got there, and the hostess didn't even bother to clean it when I asked her to that my boyfriend had to.  When we looked at our utensils, there was junk on it.  A cup of water had black stuff floating in it.  We ordered wine, and our glasses looked frosty white from the soap stains on it.  It was unbelievably gross.  The food was good though.  But in terms of cleanliness, it was disgusting.  I prefer to go to other CPKs.

CPK definintely has the tastiest dishes.  I normally always get thier tostada pizza with no chiken or salsa ( due to me being vege) and it is the BOMB! Yesterday my friend and i went and i was  not let down again...The original chicken bbq salad with no chicken is YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMYYYYY!. I substituted avocado for the chkn and it was still tasty as ever.  But our wiater was just oddly  too friendly.  It was nice int he beginning btu then as the stay increased he became odder and odder.  Just be cautious of the waiters..This is not my favorite place but i love coming here every once and a  while.
Found hair in the salad. Manager came to apologize and looked too sloppy himself. Never will go back

this is over-priced digiorno's in my opinion.  why would anyone be excited over CALIFORNIA pizza (an area that's NOT famous for its pizza, like NY or chicago or even boston).... that should be your first red flag.  the sauce tastes like it's all sugary, and the crust tastes like it's been frozen (hence the comparison to digiorno's).  if you want CA-style food, this is not the way to go.  save your money!

I have always had a good experience here...except for one of the waitresses who was a complete...BIATCH! But honestly the food is always good, fast, the bathrooms are always clean...the daiquiris suck...But overall is great i love the Thai crunch salad...yummy with edamame
They always manage to screw up our order and make us late to work.  I like cpk, but this one needs some help from corporate

This place should be shut down. I dont know what i was thinking going to this one on a Monday night around 8pm. Should've gone to the Burbank one. So i get there and right when i get seated there were linguine and pasta, bread crumb shit on my sofa chair and I told the receptionist that theres shit on it so she just said "ok". then she cleaned it with her right hand, really..her right hand..put all that shit on the ground and told me to sit. nice.. then i try to put my plate on my side.. it was'nt even placed on my side..there was lots of bread crumbs and pasta stain on it WTF? I told the lady that I didnt order the plate and she took it away. I ordered the mango tea drink. the mango tea tasted like they put i squirt of mango flavor on it and extra splenda.. this drink was horrible..skimpy on the syrup heavy on the splenda..Next I ordered the Chinese chicken salad and the lettuce and carrots were shredded so thinly.. it was also stale and brown..so this Hispanic manager happens to come by and ask if everything was ok. I told him no your salad taste like it was yesterdays salad..then he said you shouldnt eat it if it taste like shit. i told him u dumass if i told u that..you would probably give me extra sauce..he asked me if i wanted something else..i decline. i told him his GLENDALE CPK sucks and I normally eat at Burbank.. he said he came from there..I asked him if he got demoted.. anyways. so i ended up with the chicken garlic linguine it was ok..dam did the portions here get smaller.. i shoulda told that fuckr to supersize it.. Oh yea they keep the place really DARK and GLOOMY so you wouldn't find anything crawling in your food.. I couldn't wait to get the hell outa there..whoever eats here and gives it a 5 star should be shot..or 4..or 3..or 2..oh yea read Sarah P.'s review she can back me up..
i love the barbeque chicken pizza, their food is wonderful quality and the environment is fun! not too fancy but not to casual.

Great service, but they kinda make you wait. Food is really, really, good, and that's an understatement. they make great drinks as well. It's a pizza kitchen, so they pretty much serve Pizza (mainly), so if your group decides to go there, you're pretty much going to end up eating pizza (not the burger or steak you would have normally ordered when dining out).

Never again will we order for a company's lunch to eat here.  Not once the told us there is a fee based out your total sales.  Be aware of this fee.  This is bad for future service. you would think they would want us to keep ordering with CPK but t not like this. your fee's based of what we order. The sad party is that the company's meeting was down the street. Grt food and the delivery guy is really nice but I called the manager about this and he was just a jerk about it.

Very disappointed in the location. After waiting over 30 minutes for a seat a man approaches the hostess clearly upset over the wait time. We were all upset due to the wait time and understaffed location but waited patiently. This man didn't even wait 1 minute before the hostess called her supervisor and that supervisor seated him immediately. I have 2 kids and if I had known all I needed was to be dramatic to have a seat right away I would have made a scene with the kids. Just wanted to update this, shortly after we were seated my husband spoke to the manager in charge. His name was Ismael, we told him how frustrating the situation was and he heard us out patiently. He apologized and presented us with 2 appetizers. We appreciated the gesture but hope they can consider the folks patiently waiting before seating a grown brat!

alfredo pasta tasted good, we ordered 2 steaks and hey were both burned. The portions for the pizzas as well as pasta also decreased in size and they remained at the same price. We saw other pizzas looking bigger while they were the same exact chipotle chicken pizza.  We asked why the pizza got smaller and our waiter said let me go check, but ignored the question and never came back with an answer. We ended up paying for everything, waited 1 hour and 30 minutes and ended up disappointed with our food.

My wife and I stopped by for a late lunch a few days ago.  We were seated in a timely manner eventhough we had not made reservations. We ordered tortilla soup and the chicken waldorf salad.  Both were exquisite!   Our waitress, Marina, provided us excellent service with a smile. We intend to come back whenever we shop at the Glendale Americana.
I like CPK, but this location makes pizzas that have crusts that taste like cardboard. Don't waste your money here.

Good quality food and fast service. After ordering, the waiter brought a plate of warm crusty sour dough bread with an olive oil dip. Shortly after, our California club pizza and a half roasted vegetable salad. My order was the salad. It tasted great! Half the half-salad and one slice of the pizza was enough to satisfy me. I'm not really a salad person but I love roasted veggies. The roasted eggplant and artichoke is enough to make the salad really feel like a meal.

I can't give this place any less than 4 stars only because I come here pretty often. I love their food.. salads/pizzas/appetizers are all delicious ESPECIALLY their chicken lettuce wraps and quinoa arugula salad. The most recent time I went to CPK was about 2 weeks ago. I realized that they had changed their menu (which is a good thing).. but they took off their 'Lite Adventures' category which was what I would mainly order off of. They have other healthy choices, but it was nice to have the lighter sides grouped together just for our convenience. Waiters are not consistent AT ALL. Sometimes I get a really attentive waiter, other times my waiter doesn't even come to check up on us until we're waving our hands up to get his/her attention...gets pretty annoying after a while.

We ate there to just grab some appetizers and dessert... my favorite Butter Cake. The host who sat us and the waitress, Anna, was excellent. Anna checked on us constantly and really knows what great customer service means. Food was served quick as well!!!!! Great job!!!
Absolutely the worst steak I've ever had in my life. It was dry and tasted like paper.

** This Review is for our takeout/delivery experience** We usually like CPK and we have mostly dined in several locations including this one.  We were craving good pizza and decided to order from CPK via DoorDash. We ordered two pizzas, one chicken roasted garlic and one four cheese pizza.  We were very disappointed with our food and it did not satisfy our craving at all.  The food arrived COLD and about 2 inches from the edge of the crust was empty, no joke, there were no ingredients in about 1/3rd of the pizza.  We'll never order pizza from CPK again

Was going to go to Olive Garden, but the wait was too long. Decided to come to cpk instead and it ended up being a good move. My boyfriend and I got a free appetizer since it was our first time here. We got the garlic chicken pizza, salad, and macncheese. All the food was really tasty. Good experience.

I think I love CPK now... Over the years I'd hardly ever go but I have 1 friend who loved this place so I would always go with her (Hi Mutter! ).  All those experiences must have grown on me because I found myself craving this place as of late. My favorite pizza would have to be a 3 way tie been the Sicilian, the habanero carnitas & the tricolore pizza salad. All are really good, just depends what you're in the mood for. They recently brought back the strawberry shortcake which is a great dessert and introduced some new freshly made margaritas. I was very surprised by the quality of ingredients &  shocked that this good of a drink could come from CPK. Makes it worth trying to go to happy hour here.

Fine dining at its best. I must say this restuarant is a best choice for view ,food, and drink, I enjoy the panoramic views for window Seating. I am glad to see a place where  Customers feel very welcomed  And greeted by very  Nice staff. The speed of service was not Bad at all for being a busy Sunday evening. Ice teas are very delicious with Tropical flavor. Food is most delicious! !!!! A definate place to dine in for pizzas in Glendale.

After sunday mass we decided to hit up CPK in Glendale. This particular location has a grand view of Central Ave. Nothing better than having an excellent view, on a beautiful Sunday afternoon as you enjoy your delicious meal. As soon as we entered, the receptionist at the front greeted us with a gorgeous smile. What a way to enter a restaurant, to be welcomed, and feel like you're welcomed. As soon as we were seated, we were greeted by our server Frank. Frank was excellent! Period. This is a guy that enjoys his work. Very lively, fun, and playful, and of course professional. For refreshments we ordered: Coffee, Strawberry Lemonade, and Water. For appetizer, we ordered: SPINACH ARTICHOKE DIP. For Main Course, we ordered: She ordered: BOLOGNESE SPAGHETTI (it was actually pretty darn tasty!) Yours truly ordered: THE ORIGINAL BBQ CHICKEN PIZZA w/Applewood Smoked Bacon, and Fresh Pineapple. (My ultimate favorite! I keep coming back to CPK, JUST. FOR. THIS! In conclusion, we always have a positive experience here. Special positive mention is our server Frank. He made our experience here very fun. When I was torn between ordering Thai Pizza, and BBQ Chicken Pizza. He gave me the CPK CHALLENGE! Basically, if they give this challenge, you are given a chance to order something from their menu that you've been wanting to try, and if somehow you don't like it,  they will fit the bill, and give you, your original order.  They will not charge you for trying something you didn't like. So when he gave me the CPK CHALLENGE, I went ahead and ordered the THAI PIZZA, and sure enough I didn't like it. So he gave me my original order.  At no extra charge. Excellent! So when you're there make sure to ask for Frank. And be ready to be wowed by his fantastic personality, that will make you give him a generou$ tip.

Came here for Mother's Day and as always it was busy. However, the staff are always friendly and they tried their best to accommodate our needs. We went with a fairly large group including kids. It's always interesting with kids!! Our server was really nice and great with the kids and provided great service.  As a new mom i also try to incorporate "Mommy Friendlyness" in my reviews as that is what is important to me. The criteria in which I judge "Mommy Friendly"  includes: 1. Changing table in the restroom 2. A place to store my stroller safely if not allowed in the restaurant  3. A sling to safely place an infant car seat 4. Food for kids CPK scores 4/4 based on the criteria listed above. However, the condition of their women's restroom really needs help. This is really my only gripe with this place. The condition of their women's restroom is atrocious. Their changing table was so disgusting I couldn't use it. Instead I took my baby back to the car to change her diaper there instead.  I know a day like Mother's Day the restaurant is probably busier, but I think someone needs to do a better job of maintaining the cleanliness of their women's restroom- Blek!

We tried 3 kinds of pizza, one garlic fettuccini pasta, mac and cheese balls. I like The works pizza best. All the carbs made me feel very heavy. My family loved it, although I am not very fond of cpk. Maybe I should  try to find something else next time.Will do next time. Might fond something that will really wow me.

I mean we all been to CPK  But this ones tired.  Poor service.  Attitudes.  I called the 818 number on Yelp and it said to hit option one to order outside pick up. Kept getting fast busy. So I hit option #3 to talk to Someone and they were reluctant take my order. Weird.  Finally the guy did.  It's way too pricey.  One pizza and two large salads were 46$  Didn't even get some alcohol. Dammm gina.  Glendale rocks and our options rock go away CPK we can use that dope spot for a cool business that appreciates us.

CPK doesn't really change from place to place in terms of quality of the food. The pizza is good, but not like out of this world. That is nice because you can always count on going to CPK and having a decent meal. I'm not going to waste time talking about the food, because like i said it is decent and doesn't change location to location.  Usually I come here to pickup lunches for my department (more on that latter). Sometimes though I come here though for my own lunch. The service is really hit or miss, and usually is miss. On my last time here for lunch our waitress forgot our waters after we asked her twice. On the second time she only brought one back. My ice tea was never refilled (nor was there an offer to refill it). She also spaced on my pizza dough rewards points and brought us the full check after I told her I had the rewards and gave  her my rewards number. Pretty typical experience for me when I go for my own lunch.  The takeout process usually is much better. Usually when I go to pickup an order I deal with Sarah. Sarah is my CPK hero. I go often enough that she knows me by name and already has entered my pizza dough number for me. She is just that awesome. I can also count on her to have my order ready to go with little to no waiting time. She makes the CPK experience really great. That being said when she isn't there the takeout process is a mess. For example I went to pickup a small order the other day and she wasn't there. The order was to be ready at 11:18. There were three, that is right THREE, people working the takeout counter. My order wasn't ready till 11:35... The woman who gave me my order also forgot my receipt and my pizza dough number. Where was Sarah when I needed her!  So decent food with spotty service.   55/100

For a CPK, this is as good as it gets. I am here frequently with my family when we don't go to our local Burbank one, and the experience is always great. Service is friendly and food is always made well. The pizzas are delicious and they have the best ranch and desserts!

Not really fine dining aka expensive, but the food was excellent and the service was perfect. We hadn't been to CPK for ages, so it just sounded good. I had the Thai Chicken Salad, half order which was more than enough, same with my husband's Roasted Chicken and vegetables. Both were prepared perfectly. Service was excellent, the manager comped us an order of guacamole as a welcome back present. Our glasses were never empty, but our waitress was not intrusive at all.

We order from them all the time for our clients or for our own office catered lunches. We placed an online order today for a chicken piccata, thai chicken pizza, and pepperoni pizza. On the specifications, it says no peanuts on the thai pizza. The pizza was made with peanuts. Brian, server, was professional and said because they just opened and were busy didn't have time to call but made me, as a customer happy by following the correct procedures and took care of the entire situation perfectly.  End of the day, there was a MISTAKE but they fixed it and he got the manager involved to resolve the situation immediately. Great customer service.

We had a lovely time here. We sat at a booth with a nice view. Our server was great. We asked questions and he answered them honestly. We had a hard time deciding what to eat so we decided to share our dinner, family style. Portion sizes were big enough for us to do that.  Everything we had was amazing! Our server kept checking back and refilling our drinks.

Been here several times.  LOVE their food, especially their salads and soups.  While waiting for your food, you get to munch on some bread.  Our waitress was extremely nice and tentative to our water needs. As I was eating my bread, I checked out the place from my booth.  Their booths are comfortable and plentiful. I didn't order anything from the bar, but it looked inviting.   My quinoa salad finally arrived, and totally enjoyed it.  No leftovers to bring home.  I only ordered the half salad, but it was filling enough.   My kid ordered the lettuce wraps, and it's still one of my favorite dishes.  She actually had leftovers!  My youngest ordered the pasta with the tomatoes on the side.  I was lucky to get to eat the tomatoes the following day.  Still tasted great!   Free parking in the structure with validation. Join their perks rewards and earn points towards food!

I was really excited to try their new BAHN MI SALAD, but I must say very disappointed.  The flavors in a Bahn Mi sandwich are particular and I was interested in how this flavor would be interpreted in a salad.  One of the dilemmas with the CPK salad is that the protein is chicken; the traditional bahn mi is not chicken.  At best, they should have made it is a bbq pork.  The vegetable in the salad were very dry - pickled would have been better.  Then the greens in the salad were very bitter - nothing about the bahn mi is bitter.  Instead of cilantro or coriander, they used mint as the flavoring herb.  Lastly, the dressing was tart.

While the food really bad, it was not worth the money and I was not a huge fan of the service either. Pizzas are pretty small, a personal at twice the price as other places. The salads are anything but healthy and the apps just straight out of the freezer. Too many better dining options here to return to CPK.

One of my favorite restaurants! Great food and great service! Serj our waiter was awesome and very nice he gave us excellent service and made sure we were satisfied with our meal definitely coming back!

location: Sherman Oaks, Los Angeles, United States
review: Nothing special. Food is not something special. Service is not something special.They were able to accommodate a large group, but even though I told them ahead of time to make sure to bring out the birthday cake slice they have for birthdays, they did not. I even told them that I did not want to have to remind them again because it was supposed to be a surprise. Yeah, that did not happen. No cake. No surprise for the birthday girl.

I remember when CPK was only an appetizer + pizza menu in metropolitan cities and grocery freezer sections. So I was shocked happy that there were lots of vegetable rich menu items. I ate vegetarian.  The soup was just okay. But let me tell you, the mushroom pasta was the best I ever ate.  Service was very quick and friendly. CPK Glendale's on the second floor facing Brand Blvd. There's easy access with an escalator. Prices competitive to upscale retail food chains.

This 5 star rating is for the server Alfredo. He's what customer service should be about! He always comes to the table with a smile and says thank you left and right without sounding so forced. He's fast and efficient too, he brought our iced teas without even asking because he knew we were almost finished with it. Always loved coming to cpk and this is the best location because of Alfredo!

CPK service last night was really disappointing. The service was terrible. I'm a type of person that does not complain about anything and instead be more understanding. Last night, it took forever to get our drink. We.were almost done with dinner when our drinks finally came. I ordered spicy Bloody Mary. When the waiter handed my drink,  I was surprised...no olives and a stick of celery. They used to make Bloody Mary looks good. I asked the waiter for celery and olive. When he came back, the waiter states, "our manager said that we no longer serve Bloody Mary with celery"! WaaaaI could have paid extra for a stick of celery.

I really like CPK, but on my first visit to this location, I found it very dry. The BBQ chicken on the pizza and the chicken in the Chinese Chicken Salad were dry.  It kinda tasted like premade chicken breast strips.  The pizza was good, but tastes exactly like the CPK frozen pizzas they sell at target for $5.  The Chinese Chicken salad was good besides the dry chicken.   I would come back again cause I've always liked CPK, I'm hoping it was just this one time. I also wanna try the butter cake.

We were here few weeks ago,food and service was great. We decided to try it again. As always food and service were great. I made a wrong reservations but we received an excellent service from shift Manager Frances. Thank you Frances.

CPK is probably one of my favorite places to eat at! They have good food and usually good servers, but this one was a miss. We got our orders in and asked for more bread, which never came. Took us a while to flag our server and it seemed like she checked up on all her tables except ours. She only checked in when we finally got our food, about 35 minutes after we ordered. Didn't offer us the dessert menu and printed out our check right away. Wasn't a fan of their service this time.

I went here last night and had the BBQ chicken pizza, chicken lettuce cups, and a little bit of kung pao spaghetti with chicken. Woke up late last night with severe food poisoning. The staff was nice when we picked up our food which is why I'm rating it 2. And the other time I went here I was fine (didn't order any chicken or potentially unwashed lettuce that time). But I'm in so much pain, vomiting, and in bed all day with the chills and cramps. I thought I'd write a review warning others to stay away from any chicken here. Or just be wary in general.

Well, it was a weird night at CPK that's for sure... BF had a gift card that we felt like using tonight to celebrate his birthday. We were seated promptly and had pretty decent service for the beginning portion of the meal. Drinks were on point, appetizers were good too..but I was soooo distracted by the domestic violence (basically) situation happening in the booth next to us. The couple was running in and out of the restaurant and there was a lot of commotion happening. The waiter was really trying to do his best to accommodate whatever was going on (canceling orders, reordering orders, etc.).  Total. Shitshow. Basically the guy in the relationship ends up freaking out and throws one of the drink glasses shattering it EVERYWHERE! (Including on us). I rushed up to help the girl immediately after he left, but NO ONE from the restaurant came over to help?!? I stood there glaring at servers who were just standing around gawking at the scene...it took me flagging someone down to ask for management to come help clean up the shards of glass everywhere. Eventually the manager made her way around the tables checking up on everyone. She gave us a free dessert for helping out, which was definitely appreciated (and an appropriate response on her part). It just baffled me that no one responded immediately to glass shattering all over the place when there is food being consumed in the area?!?!?!  The event had us shaken up for the rest of the night...the food was good but that whole debacle definitely skewed the evening, and I admit, this rating.

For work I'm always placing very large 'to go' orders and when it comes to having everything ready on time and labeled as asked, CPK definitely knows what it's doing. At times an order here or there isn't quite right, but within minutes they have it fixed.  They always offer to help me to my car and are super friendly. Highly recommend them for large take out orders. Thanks!

Came here on a weekday for dinner around 9 pm.  We were checked in immediatelyy for a party of 5.  Waiter was very pleasant and attentive.  Slices of bread with olive oil was brought and refilled promptly.  Food was so-so.  We ordered tortilla soup,  jambalaya fettuccine,  chicken piccata, cheese pizza from kids menu.  It took some time to get our food but we munched on the bread.  Portion size was good for the price you pay.  I have dined at CPK before and liked their pizzas.  The staff was very friendly with kids and that's a major factor for me to visit the restaurant again.

Always a great dining experience in this location. I have been to other locations but this spot is my fave so far. The parking lot is not the most convenient but if you park on P3, it's easy access to the restaurant.   It's a chain so no need to really talk about the menu but I do like how they can customize my salt intake to accommodate my dialysis diet regimen. My go to meal here is the quinoa and arugula salad with salmon. The half order is plenty a serving and I usually only eat half of it and pack the rest.  Their lettuce wraps are fresh and so tasty too and the market soup I think it's called is great.  The service is very attentive and the servers hustle. When it's busy there is a bit of a wait for a table but once seated and ordered, the staff and even the manager wait on you hand and foot.

I placed a large order to go curbside. Two garlic cream fettuccine's, a child's cheese pizza, and a grilled vegetable salad with the salmon option. The Salmon is an additional 5.00. There's four cubes included with bits??? Am I a cat? A drive home to discover, and 5.00 refund. I'm a former regular customer.

If you want to wait an over extended amount of time and have other people that arrived after you seated than this is the place to come. My husband and I have had to walk out of this location on multiple occasion because if the same issue. I understand that Weekend are a busy time but when you have the same number of people in your party and constantly have other people who clearly arrived after you seated before you is quite irritating.  As far as the food...can't complain at all. The food is always to your liking and if it's wrong they will change it for you.

Never again will we order for a company's lunch to eat here.  Not once the told us there is a fee based out your total sales.  Be aware of this fee.  This is bad for future service. you would think they would want us to keep ordering with CPK but t not like this. your fee's based of what we order. The sad party is that the company's meeting was down the street. Grt food and the delivery guy is really nice but I called the manager about this and he was just a jerk about it.

Very disappointed in the location. After waiting over 30 minutes for a seat a man approaches the hostess clearly upset over the wait time. We were all upset due to the wait time and understaffed location but waited patiently. This man didn't even wait 1 minute before the hostess called her supervisor and that supervisor seated him immediately. I have 2 kids and if I had known all I needed was to be dramatic to have a seat right away I would have made a scene with the kids. Just wanted to update this, shortly after we were seated my husband spoke to the manager in charge. His name was Ismael, we told him how frustrating the situation was and he heard us out patiently. He apologized and presented us with 2 appetizers. We appreciated the gesture but hope they can consider the folks patiently waiting before seating a grown brat!

alfredo pasta tasted good, we ordered 2 steaks and hey were both burned. The portions for the pizzas as well as pasta also decreased in size and they remained at the same price. We saw other pizzas looking bigger while they were the same exact chipotle chicken pizza.  We asked why the pizza got smaller and our waiter said let me go check, but ignored the question and never came back with an answer. We ended up paying for everything, waited 1 hour and 30 minutes and ended up disappointed with our food.

My wife and I stopped by for a late lunch a few days ago.  We were seated in a timely manner eventhough we had not made reservations. We ordered tortilla soup and the chicken waldorf salad.  Both were exquisite!   Our waitress, Marina, provided us excellent service with a smile. We intend to come back whenever we shop at the Glendale Americana.
I like CPK, but this location makes pizzas that have crusts that taste like cardboard. Don't waste your money here.

Good quality food and fast service. After ordering, the waiter brought a plate of warm crusty sour dough bread with an olive oil dip. Shortly after, our California club pizza and a half roasted vegetable salad. My order was the salad. It tasted great! Half the half-salad and one slice of the pizza was enough to satisfy me. I'm not really a salad person but I love roasted veggies. The roasted eggplant and artichoke is enough to make the salad really feel like a meal.

I can't give this place any less than 4 stars only because I come here pretty often. I love their food.. salads/pizzas/appetizers are all delicious ESPECIALLY their chicken lettuce wraps and quinoa arugula salad. The most recent time I went to CPK was about 2 weeks ago. I realized that they had changed their menu (which is a good thing).. but they took off their 'Lite Adventures' category which was what I would mainly order off of. They have other healthy choices, but it was nice to have the lighter sides grouped together just for our convenience. Waiters are not consistent AT ALL. Sometimes I get a really attentive waiter, other times my waiter doesn't even come to check up on us until we're waving our hands up to get his/her attention...gets pretty annoying after a while.

We ate there to just grab some appetizers and dessert... my favorite Butter Cake. The host who sat us and the waitress, Anna, was excellent. Anna checked on us constantly and really knows what great customer service means. Food was served quick as well!!!!! Great job!!!

review: Absolutely the worst steak I've ever had in my life. It was dry and tasted like paper.

We were craving good pizza and decided to order from CPK via DoorDash. We ordered two pizzas, one chicken roasted garlic and one four cheese pizza.  We were very disappointed with our food and it did not satisfy our craving at all.  The food arrived COLD and about 2 inches from the edge of the crust was empty, no joke, there were no ingredients in about 1/3rd of the pizza.  We'll never order pizza from CPK again

Was going to go to Olive Garden, but the wait was too long. Decided to come to cpk instead and it ended up being a good move. My boyfriend and I got a free appetizer since it was our first time here. We got the garlic chicken pizza, salad, and macncheese. All the food was really tasty. Good experience.

I think I love CPK now... Over the years I'd hardly ever go but I have 1 friend who loved this place so I would always go with her (Hi Mutter! ).  All those experiences must have grown on me because I found myself craving this place as of late. My favorite pizza would have to be a 3 way tie been the Sicilian, the habanero carnitas & the tricolore pizza salad. All are really good, just depends what you're in the mood for. They recently brought back the strawberry shortcake which is a great dessert and introduced some new freshly made margaritas. I was very surprised by the quality of ingredients &  shocked that this good of a drink could come from CPK. Makes it worth trying to go to happy hour here.

Fine dining at its best. I must say this restuarant is a best choice for view ,food, and drink, I enjoy the panoramic views for window Seating. I am glad to see a place where  Customers feel very welcomed  And greeted by very  Nice staff. The speed of service was not Bad at all for being a busy Sunday evening. Ice teas are very delicious with Tropical flavor. Food is most delicious! !!!! A definate place to dine in for pizzas in Glendale.

Not really fine dining aka expensive, but the food was excellent and the service was perfect. We hadn't been to CPK for ages, so it just sounded good. I had the Thai Chicken Salad, half order which was more than enough, same with my husband's Roasted Chicken and vegetables. Both were prepared perfectly. Service was excellent, the manager comped us an order of guacamole as a welcome back present. Our glasses were never empty, but our waitress was not intrusive at all.

We made a trip to CPK after not visiting for a while. After our most recent visit, we were thoroughly pleased with the experience. Jessica was our server and she did a pretty good job. She was attentive, informative and made sure we didn't wait long for refills.  The food was awesome! Since we hadn't visited in a while, they were nice enough to give us a complimentary appetizer to welcome (major cool points for this). We ordered the BBQ chicken salad, Jamaican Jerk chicken pizza and tequila fettuccine pasta with shrimp. Everything tasted amazing! The strawberry lime margarita is one of their better alcoholic drinks. It's a perfect blend of strawberry with just the right amount of tequila. We will definitely be coming back to CPK!

A friend and I came in here to have lunch a few days ago. The food was great as usual (if you haven't tried the jerk chicken pizza yet.....DO SO.) After we left we realized he had left his wallet with $300 cash inside. By the time we realized the restaurant was closed. The next morning we called and asked if the wallet had been found. They took our contact information and said they'd get back to us. Soon afterward, they called and said they found it and put it in the safe. We went to pick up the wallet expecting the cash to be gone but just grateful not to have lost the other things... to our surprise all the cash was inside safely! I just thought that was the most honest, noble thing. This location is a bit far from me but I will make it a point to come to this one whenever I come to CPK! Thank you guys so much, great team and great service!
Walked in waited at the bar for 10 minutes got  no help. No other customers at the bar  The place was pretty empty. Employees kept walking by avoiding eye contact.

I give two stars for our waitress only.As far as Food zero stars.Sicilian pizza was like a rubber and their salad all you can taste was the disgusting taste of onions.lm gonna stop coming here for now.
The bartender that took care of us was very friendly and her drinks were great! My mojito was delicious and the margarita was awesome.

Boo thang and I, came to CPK to have dinner. It was our first time at this location. The view on the Second level was so beautiful. I must say; rhe service was beyond AMAZING. The hostess Brian was very sweet, sat us and wiped our table down. The waitress Jessica, was so adorable, and she checked on us Continuously!!! Then the manager Ann was like the icing on the cake! She brought us a complimentary appetizer.!  The best service I've had thus far!! THANK YOU MUCH CPK in GLENDALE !!

Poor costumer service, I'll start by saying that last week I came here to the same location had dinner and asked for a  "Moscow mule" (amazing drink) here in the pic you can see location drink and time.... wasn't asked for ID and actually never have in any restaurant.. I was with my husband and two kids. Today I came to the same location asked for the same thing and this time I was asked for ID come on I'm 30 years old I said and the server said with out I'd I cannot sell u a drink.. I asked to speak to the manager and he denied service as well.... we felt very discriminated......
California Pizza Kitchen is one of my favorite restaraunts. The service is great and my waiter is always on the job. Food takes extraordinarily great. I really recommend this restaurant.

To start, I've always loved CPK from their appetizers, salads, soups down to their pastas. With that in mind, I called in a take-out order for a cheese and  margherita pizza. When I checked my order prior to leaving, they gave me a five cheese pizza which was different from a regular cheese pizza. Five cheese has fresh tomatoes and basil. It looked good, but it wasn't quite what I wanted or ordered.  We waited another five minutes for the cheese pizza order. After the cheese pizza order arrived, the very kind male manager, who clearly was running around all evening not only helping serve and make drinks, help with the registers and take-out, kindly handed us all three pizzas! He thanked us for so being patient. I already know the pizzas are going to be tasteful because it's CPK, but the manager deserves this five star rating.

Lunch here is great and the staff was wonderful. Our waiter/bartender was very nice and fast. I definitely recommend the Moscow Mule here and my party really enjoyed their blood orange sangrias. I recommend lunch here.

*Delivery Review* Used Grub Hub for delivery.  The food arrived horribly cold.  Reheating it wasn't enough to revive it. I pointed out the food was already cold when it arrived - the driver indicated that he had another delivery prior.  According to the website tracker, the food was picked up nearly 45 minutes before it arrived. The driver's other drop off was in the opposite direction and quite a bit farther than I live to CPK (less than 2 miles). Total time was well over 1.5hours - website was advertising 40-50min delivery. Also, I paid for extra sauces and the delivery person dropped them on my porch.
10 minutes to be seated when we were the only group in line, 1 HOUR to get our food and it was COLD.  The pasta was properly cooked though, or this would be 1 star.

So today my friend and I came to to California Pizza to have something delightful. Let me tell you, Kati our server was kick ass about her customer service and giving us her honest feedback about the food. I definitely would come back and have her bent server. She was so mellow and has a personality a lot of restaurants need to have. I think she made the food 10x better just by putting in all her effort for our dining in. Thank you so much Kati! Keep doing you!

The service is very good but the disregard for safety is not good. I've spoken to staff before but nothing has changed - sad.  The area around the one and only emergency exit is cluttered with ladders, chairs, and high-chairs.

Thank you Alex for being such a great attentive host, also Wendy did an awesome job of being our waitress. Now for the food..I never had the Chicken Piccatta, but when i tried, it instantly became my favorite dish. Us 3 had half serving of a Waldorf salad and Sicilian pizza. So good. But I always come back for their tasty Chicken Piccata.
