Been here for lunch and dinner many years ago and I dont remember what I ate, but I do remember the pizza being on the smaller side and it was just ok.  What I do remember is recently when I had the : Roasted Vegetable (friends suggestion). It was good, A lot of food for a salad, and it was very delicious!  California Club. Really well made..  tasted just like any other California chicken club Chocolate Soufflé Cake... YUUUMMY, very good.. too bad us 3 got 1 to share! that was a mistake we will never repeat again.  Our work orders food from CPK regularly, not specifically from this location but their pasta is pretty good, and the bbq chicken pizza is not bad either.  Lets just say Im a fan! =] but since I wouldnt choose to go here myself I cant give them 4 stars...  p.s. at this location sit by the window makes your dining experience much better!

I haven't eaten at CPK for a while, but wanted to use a gift card that I received.  I had the white pizza with bacon added.  It was OK.  Flavor of the Ricotta was overwhelmed by the regular cheese melted on the pizza, and texturally, it didn't do much.  I scraped most of it off.  Roasted garlic worked well. I was there early and it was not busy yet.  The hostess was on the phone taking a very long take out order. After many minutes of waiting, I finally caught her eye and asked if I should seat myself.  She finally put the call on hold and seated me. There were a number of wait staff idling, and there really was no reason for me to be standing at the entry door for so long.  If food is not exceptional, then service is a main differentiator when there are so many other restaurant choices.  Mother Dough, for example, has much better pizza. Service was fine once I was seated and the hostess did apologize.  I like all the natural light in the space.
Nice cpk a bit long wait time but really nice pizza and good service, they have a lot of other kinds of food, not only pizza, spaghetti Alfredo very good. Must try yam
The food is amazing. One of my favorite pizza parlors especially the thin crusts. Very friendly staff and the waiter Aaron was very professional helping us to choose. Thanks

The service was really bad. We had to wait for everything. The food wasn't a whole lot better.  We had been there recently and I had ordered the Kung Pao spaghetti and it was great. Had a great kick to it. Was very excited about having it again, even giving up my favorite mexican restaurant to come have this dish again. Unfortunately, it's wasn't nearly as good...didn't even come close. The dish had no heat. I had to eat the red chilis that came with the dish to get some spice. I asked the waiter about why there would be such a difference and he just replied, different cook. Well, I won't be rushing back for dinner anytime soon. I can easily make this dish at home. Very bummed by the experience.
The lettuce wraps and "to die for" pizza with excellent service is definitely a restaurant that I'll go back

McDonald's restroom is in better shape than the Men's room at this CPK. No running hot water; mildew and mold; 99 cent soap dispenser with graffiti on it. The door to the room was so dirty that when I pushed it, I thought it was locked because the grease around the edges made it stick.  Food was good.  Service was OK. Waiter didn't know the menu but was was attentive to our table.

it's kinda funny, i've tried their frozen pizzas tons of times but never went to the restaurant to try it fresh until last year. CPK definitely is great with their funky little pizzas. i love their shrimp scampi pizza. mmmmm. and their avocado egg rolls are a must have as an appetizer. they also have flavored iced teas and i usually get peach.  a decent spot for a quick lunch that your tastebuds will not regret!

Best CPK. Our server Nikki was friendly and gracious without being overbearing. Attention to detail was put into each dish we ordered. The host validated our parking ticket right when we walked in (I assume so that we won't forget!). Great view!

im not picky. so when i award a location five stars it usually means the food, service, and ease of arriving/leaving to said location was on point. it doesnt mean the chef is top notch or they served the best expensive wine. good food is meant to be enjoyed in every possible (and comfortable) way.  i dont crave CPK. in fact, if i wanted pizza i could just walk across the street from my apartment and get it for cheap. but i was so impressed with how awesome i felt entering and leaving this place.  the parking garage entrance is located on broadway and brand. the entrance to CPK is on the 3rd level, so park in that area. it was the middle of the day on sunday, but i pulled right into an open spot. once i reached the hostess, she offered to validate my parking ticket right away. quality service, and i havent even been seated yet! im on a mission to try every pizza on the menu, and i havent been disappointed yet. i stick with my favorite appetizers (garlic foccocia, artichoke dip, those eggroll things...) when i return, but it takes me so damn long to decide which pizza to try because they all sound so good. so this time around, i got two.  while we enjoyed our meal, our waitress was extremely attentive, pleasant, and NOT a ruhtard for once. the bill was exceptionally inexpensive for all the food we ordered and didnt eat. AND they even said goodbye as we were walking out the door. these might all be standard things you expect when dining out, but you usually dont receive it. im glad i can expect good things at a chain of all places, and leave happy, stuffed, and leftovers in hand.

I honestly can say that I have never had a bad experience at CPK. I particularly like this location, too! I just looooove their Thai Chicken Salad crunchy goodness. And basically every type of pizza they have to offer is awesome. Hooray for CPK. Plus, they give 10% local students at most CPKs, inquire within.

I give 5 because I was highly pleased with the service. So many places suck. This place didn't. 1 Mango and peach lemonade. The peach was a little too sour but I liked it. I never find these anywhere else so they are a fun different drink. 2 Hummes appetizer with pita bread - tasty and fresh and came promptly. I even licked the spoon.  3 Miso salad with crab and shrimp - super fresh and i loved the variety of napa cabbage, edamame, green onion, avocado, and the crab and shrimp. Not enough of the miso dressing but I got more later. Yay for weird salads. 4 "The works" pizza with bacon added - yum. I prefer BBQ chicken but this one was good too. Mmmm.. bacon. 5 Bread - I had to request it because I think the server thought there was enough food. WRONG because I love the bread... plus I hadn't eaten the whole day. I love you bread. So anyways, that was food reviews. All of it was fresh, delicious.  Then comes service: We only waited about 10 minutes on a Friday night which is awesome since Olive Garden and BJ's had a 40 million  minute wait. Waiter came promptly and took our entire order (we planned during our 10 minutes) then everything came out smoothly.  When I asked for more dressing or bread it came in a minute or sooner. Awesome!  He came and checked on us, got us refills, and tried to chit-chat but I was too busy eating.  At the end the bill with all of the above as about 20 per person with a 8 dollar tip. Not bad at all and I was happy.
I don't eat salads much but I LOVE their green field salad with caramelized walnuts. I always ask to add shrimp that takes the salad to a next level to please my taste buds!

I used to like this location because I felt posh dining here in high school. Yes, expensive pizzas I could gobble up in three bites while onlooking the view of downtown Glendale was posh for me. I've only tried the white and the shrimp scampi pizzas at this location. Totally kicks Pizza Hut in the crotch and sends it home to mama bawling. And that is an understatement, of course. If a hot little Asian mama named Jessica B. still works there, tell her I said hi =).

Haven't had CPK in years til I found out they had a gluten free menu. This location is down the street from my office so now I go often. The food is great. The service is even better. They are quick and courteous. I will be back, regularly.

Okay, so i'm always a little hesitant when writing about chains because well, frankly, whats the point. But I like CPK and their cocktails are pretty good too. I like the Glendale location because it has a nice view if you get a window seat and I don't think I've ever waited more than 5 minutes on a weekend.

Before the cheesecake factory and BJ's opened in Glendale, we used to go to this place about once per month. Overall, I always get the sense that I have been ripped off when I finish eating here. I mean, they charge like $15 for a salad which is the size of CF's or BJ's lunch size salads which cost no more than $8-9. And now, it is almost impossible to find a food item on the menu which is below $10. The thing that gets me is the fact that their food doesn't even taste that great, just average. I stopped going here after CF and BJ's opened in Glendale and I suggest you do the same.

I'm not a fan of Italian food but my family does, a home cook spaghetti is as close as i can get. Ambiance is great, service is fast, waiters are attentive. a good place to bring your family. Needless to say, we went there twice this week.. The food........still Italian, Maybe next time I'll dare myself and try linguini

I have been to CPK before, but this latest trip was a scene out of a movie.  The pizza was so so, but our server was the worst.  waiter.  ever.  It was to the point of being amusing.  The funniest part was when he took my credit card, returned ten minutes later and gave me back the exact same thing he picked up.  Nothing to sign, just the bill and my credit card.  I told him, "There's nothing to sign."  His response?  "Oh, you know what happened?  I forgot to run your credit card."  Are you serious?!?  WOW!

I love, love, love pizza.  Love.  So being here is like, ooh.  Pepperoni + mushroom = bliss.  My group has tried their salads, and each are yum, according to them.  I think this place is great for groups; their service will not disappoint you.  It'll also help to share your pizza with someone, since they give such generous portions.

This place is pretty dirty.  From when I got there, I couldn't believe the filth.  There was left over food on my side of the booth when I got there, and the hostess didn't even bother to clean it when I asked her to that my boyfriend had to.  When we looked at our utensils, there was junk on it.  A cup of water had black stuff floating in it.  We ordered wine, and our glasses looked frosty white from the soap stains on it.  It was unbelievably gross.  The food was good though.  But in terms of cleanliness, it was disgusting.  I prefer to go to other CPKs.

CPK definintely has the tastiest dishes.  I normally always get thier tostada pizza with no chiken or salsa ( due to me being vege) and it is the BOMB! Yesterday my friend and i went and i was  not let down again...The original chicken bbq salad with no chicken is YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMYYYYY!. I substituted avocado for the chkn and it was still tasty as ever.  But our wiater was just oddly  too friendly.  It was nice int he beginning btu then as the stay increased he became odder and odder.  Just be cautious of the waiters..This is not my favorite place but i love coming here every once and a  while.
Found hair in the salad. Manager came to apologize and looked too sloppy himself. Never will go back

this is over-priced digiorno's in my opinion.  why would anyone be excited over CALIFORNIA pizza (an area that's NOT famous for its pizza, like NY or chicago or even boston).... that should be your first red flag.  the sauce tastes like it's all sugary, and the crust tastes like it's been frozen (hence the comparison to digiorno's).  if you want CA-style food, this is not the way to go.  save your money!

I have always had a good experience here...except for one of the waitresses who was a complete...BIATCH! But honestly the food is always good, fast, the bathrooms are always clean...the daiquiris suck...But overall is great i love the Thai crunch salad...yummy with edamame
They always manage to screw up our order and make us late to work.  I like cpk, but this one needs some help from corporate

This place should be shut down. I dont know what i was thinking going to this one on a Monday night around 8pm. Should've gone to the Burbank one. So i get there and right when i get seated there were linguine and pasta, bread crumb shit on my sofa chair and I told the receptionist that theres shit on it so she just said "ok". then she cleaned it with her right hand, really..her right hand..put all that shit on the ground and told me to sit. nice.. then i try to put my plate on my side.. it was'nt even placed on my side..there was lots of bread crumbs and pasta stain on it WTF? I told the lady that I didnt order the plate and she took it away. I ordered the mango tea drink. the mango tea tasted like they put i squirt of mango flavor on it and extra splenda.. this drink was horrible..skimpy on the syrup heavy on the splenda..Next I ordered the Chinese chicken salad and the lettuce and carrots were shredded so thinly.. it was also stale and brown..so this Hispanic manager happens to come by and ask if everything was ok. I told him no your salad taste like it was yesterdays salad..then he said you shouldnt eat it if it taste like shit. i told him u dumass if i told u that..you would probably give me extra sauce..he asked me if i wanted something else..i decline. i told him his GLENDALE CPK sucks and I normally eat at Burbank.. he said he came from there..I asked him if he got demoted.. anyways. so i ended up with the chicken garlic linguine it was ok..dam did the portions here get smaller.. i shoulda told that fuckr to supersize it.. Oh yea they keep the place really DARK and GLOOMY so you wouldn't find anything crawling in your food.. I couldn't wait to get the hell outa there..whoever eats here and gives it a 5 star should be shot..or 4..or 3..or 2..oh yea read Sarah P.'s review she can back me up..

CPK was my go-to spot in high school. The place I fantasized taking dates had I the charisma or courage to get any girls to go on a date with me. Today, whenever I go to CPK, I hope to be transported back to those halcyon days of high school where eating chicken tequila fettucine and bullshitting with friends seemed like the pinnacle of social achievement. Instead, I am left disappointed that the food isn't as good as it is in my memories. Not sure if it's because I'm older or if the quality has gone down. Still, it's a great place for lunch (good specials) or for dinner if you're in the mood for a shit ton of food that'll leave you with leftovers.

My kids wanted to eat pizza so i decided to go to CPK and they have new menu baked potato soup it's amazing and the service was very professional. Well I'm not gone talk about pizza it's all ways good.

I will never come back here! I took my friend out here for her birthday and had a completely rude waitress! Here name was Meghan. It took me and my friend over an hour to get our food. Most importantly we got no apology or anything. I recommend going to the California Pizza Kitchen in Burbank instead of this one.

I really like CPK and eat there too often when I'm craving for some light American fare. There are many favorites on the menu but my review here is for the Glendale location. I love their "penthouse" location and view down onto Brand Blvd. There's a delightful, open feel to this establishment. They're pretty hard to come by these days.  Had lunch here last weekend. The two of us shared a full salad (BBQ chicken ranch for almost $15) and a wild mushroom pizza (about $14). The price of the food has really gone up over the years. I still remember the days of $9.95 pizzas here. My usual beverage is the strawberry iced tea. They were nice to accommodate our request for an iced coffee. They don't have it on the menu but they made one for us anyway.  I'm not crazy about their complimentary baguette. It has a raw taste to it. The herbed dipping oil is delicious though.  More than half the salad and two slices of pizza were left over from our lunch. Service was great on a busy Saturday lunch service.

The staff is attentive. The hostess greets warmly upon entering and asks if any parking validations are needed. I feel this is important as many people forget their parking ticket in the car or purposely leave it as to not lose it.  The waitress we had was very pleasant and energetic which is always a plus. Who likes a drabby waitress right? We asked for a suggestion on a pizza to share and she advised of 3 she likes. We chose the Califonia Club, which surprised with the freshness and crunchiness of the iceberg lettuce and the bacon. The avocado slices on top are a good finishing touch.  The base of the pizza has very little if any marinara. It did have chicken bits and you can add Parmesan cheese at your discretion. I see it as a salad on a pizza... Thin crispy crust of course. I had a yummy small plate arugula salad previous to the pizza and it didn't disappoint at a $5 price. It's comparable to any high end restaurant, to it's shaved Parmesan topping.  We had two slices each and two to go! Great lunch experience. Quick and efficient service and friendly staff.

We walked in at about 6 p.m. on a Saturday night.  There were several empty tables but we were told there was a 15 minute wait -- because they only had three servers and they were waiting for more  servers to arrive and start their shifts. I'm sorry, this is a very poorly managed CPK if they don't have enough waiters on a Saturday night. Rather than wait 15 minutes we decided to sit at the bar for dinner.  The bartender was nice, but clearly overworked and frazzled.  It took him soo long to bring my husband his wine that he finally canceled the wine order when he was close to finishing his dinner. The food is good, so it's sad the place is so poorly run.
I have another review for the Burbank location and I thought those guys were a great bunch of people but now I want to add that the Glendale location is just as amazing

California Pizza Kitchen is great because they use great quality ingredients. I always get the spinach dip for appetizer. Great food and even better service!! This the my favorite place for pizza. Thank you!

Horrible to say the least. It seems like customer service and just being polite has gone out the door. With most establishments in Glendale, the workers seem like they hate their jobs and they let it show. The only reason we keep coming back, not to suddenly get some good service but because my wife randomly craves their pasta or salad. Food taste and quality suddenly dropping with every order. Will be making the longer drive to a different cpk to get some kind of actual service.

The food is pretty great tasting, great service. Often the wait takes a long time, one of the biggest flaws is in their recipe and how much salt is used is abysmal. I eat here very rarely because of this but I would worry if it was more than 3 times a year.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon.  I requested a table that had a chair on one side, booth on the other.  Had to wait in the bar for 10 minutes for them to clear it, but then the hostess was seating others and kinda forgot about us until I stood in the aisle to make my presence known, at which point I was told to "just sit anywhere and I'll bring you some menus." We were still kind of in the bar area so the lady working behind the bar was our waitress.  I ordered the Thai and Baja Tortilla Spring Rolls, then a Works pizza and my son had the cheese pizza.  I told her to just put all of the orders in and bring it all as soon as it was ready, not wanting the appetizer to stretch the meal time overly long. I had iced tea and he had water.  The appetizer was okay, my son didn't like it (which is really unusual) and the pizza was really thin and kinda soggy on the bottom and not much cheese.  Price tag with tip -$55.   Way overpriced food and okay service, but the entire experience took nearly 2 hours, which is too long.  I think I'm done with CPK now.

First off the bartender I think his name is Joe was garbage. He was too slow to even take our orders. Even when he returned my change he basically tossed it back on the counter to me. In a lot of cultures I think that's considered disrespectful and rude. But the reason why I gave 5 stars was because of the manager with the hair combed back and earrings. He was extremely helpful and polite at all times. He was hard and fast working jumping around everywhere to make sure everything was going perfect. He was working under a lot of pressure and it didn't phase him. As a business owner myself it's extremely hard to find a manager as great as him. Cpk should give him a raise in my opinion. Food was good also.

The waiters at CPK are what makes this location great, so friendly and professional.  If this was a review just for them, it would be ten stars.  I'm sure I've met all of them here.  So thank you to them for always making it a great experience, and they still do.  The waiter on this particular night was stellar. I think this location as a whole is very confused about what they're actually needing to improve, so much that they got a new manager who was literally going back and forth with me over a $3.74 up charge on the same dish I've been ordering here and tons of other locations since forever.  In principle it was weird to me that he was so adamant about what the final price of the dish should be - a dish that I've been ordering with the same substitution for almost 10 years (no chicken, swap for veggies).  No location has ever been short of amazing at delivering this substitution, which is part of why CPK has had my trust.  This disagreement makes me iffy about how I feel dining here again after being a loyal customer who has spent literally thousands of dollars at CPK.  How could I not be surprised by almost $4 added to the base price?  It really disappoints me and not want to come back anymore or bring all of my family here.   So, I'm not sure how to feel - more surprised than anything.  I think they're focusing on the wrong corners to improve in Glendale.  And it really has nothing to do with the Glendale waiters - they have been the best part of this place and should be valued like gold by the company.

This review is on our server Alfred.  We've been coming to CPK for a very long time.  Food is really good and service is good to, but Alfred was an amazing server.  He was extremely nice and cordial and always made sure our drinks were topped off.  We would come and pick up plates and just made sure we had everything we needed.   I really dislike going out to eat and getting a server who is either in a bad mood or just plain disinterested.

We love this place and we visit often. The best we like is the waiter, Al (they all are good ,buthe is very different ). He was amazing, had very high sense of humor, and was very caring about how we like the food and how we feel spending time there. He wanted to make sure we will go back again. Al, sure we will be back, you are amazing THANK YOU!
I love CPZ, don't get me wrong. The reason I am posting it is that they don't have vegetarian choices on the menu. Or maybe they have but our server just said "We don't have it" and we had to leave.
Not only did the servers point and talk about us but they passed our table  so many times and were just standing around doing nothing while we were waiting for drink refills and our check!!

This review is coming from a former CPK employee. I came to this location with my daughter for lunch on my day off from work and was immediately greeted by a friendly host, I liked how she greeted with a smile, asked how we were doing and acknowledge my little 3 year old. On a side note as we were about to get seated another employee smiled and said have a good lunch, so A* for friendly staff. After being seated we were immediately attended by 2 servers, Jed and his trainee Mike who both displayed great restaurant hospitality. Jed acknowledged my daughter as well and always checked in on us to make sure we were okay.  I mentioned to my servers I was a former employee and Jed and I had mutual co-workers so we had a little conversation about people we knew.  My experience was pleasant, food was excellent, restaurant is clean. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because throughout our dining experience I noticed the host was telling other guests about some sort of CPK promotion, sign up and get a free small plate, which when I overheard wondered why she didn't mention the promotion to me as I would have loved to sign up. Also a group got seated right next to our table and the chef came out personally and brought them a complimentary chips and guacamole. So everyone was getting some sort of special treatment besides my daughter and I.  So I hope all staff improves on consistency if there are promotions and the chefs don't just give out free stuff because it's a table of 4 ladies. Other than that my overall experience was good enough to overlook it.

The food was great but the service was even better to make for a delightful dining experience, our server Kirsten was one of the best we've had anywhere for a good long while; for starters we ordered something that wasn't on the menu for our appetizer and she made it happen... I was very pleased with that. Our food was served piping hot and she was very attentive to our drinks, she packed all our food for us very nicely and brought the check with her when she brought the food with her; to top all that off she was just very pleasant and courteous. I rarely go over 18% tip but in Kirsten's case it was a no-brainer that she deserved more... she even put a little "Thank You" happy face on the check *smiles*. Unfortunately I couldn't upload any pictures when I Checked-in because the cell signal is weak in that tower and I couldn't get Yelp to open the business page completely so if your wondering what we had it was Chips and Salsa (not on menu).. Meat Cravers thin crust (if your wondering if it has enough meat?? Yes, yes it definitely does) and the Tiramisu (OMG, sooooo rich!)

my co-workers and i order from here often, and today was the worst.  A BIG bug in 1 of our salads.   All Natalie ( manager ) said sorry, and she would refund me the salad.   The worst !!!!    they have lost good customers by the way they handled the whole thing.
i love the barbeque chicken pizza, their food is wonderful quality and the environment is fun! not too fancy but not to casual.

Great service, but they kinda make you wait. Food is really, really, good, and that's an understatement. they make great drinks as well. It's a pizza kitchen, so they pretty much serve Pizza (mainly), so if your group decides to go there, you're pretty much going to end up eating pizza (not the burger or steak you would have normally ordered when dining out).
